title: 227. GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

1 c. cider vinegar
1/2 c. vegetable or canola oil
5 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
4 tsp. hot pepper sauce
2 tsp. salt
10 bone-in chicken breast halves (10 oz. each)

preparation

In a bowl, combine the first 5 ingredients; mix well. Pour 1 cup marinade into a large resealable plastic bag. Add the chicken. Seal bag and turn to coat thoroughly. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Cover and refrigerate the remaining marinade for basting. Coat grill rack with nonstick cooking spray before starting the grill. Drain and discard marinade from chicken. Grill bone side down, covered, over indirect medium heat for 20 minutes. Turn; grill 20 to 30 minutes longer or until juices run clear, basting occasionally with reserved marinade.

title: 63. GRILLED VEGETABLE TRIO
info:
GRILLED VEGETABLE TRIO

ingredients

1 medium onion, sliced thin
1/4 c. Parmesan cheese
1/2 clove garlic, minced
2 Tbsp. butter, cut into bits
2 medium zucchini, 1/8-inch slices
1/2 tsp. thyme leaves
dash of pepper
2 medium tomatoes, quartered

preparation

Tear off a length of aluminum foil. Place onion in center of foil in single layer. Top with zucchini, cheese, seasonings and butter. Bring four corners of foil up together in pyramid shape. Fold openings together loosely for heat circulation and expansion. Seal by folding over ends and pressing to package. Grill over medium hot coals 20 minutes. Carefully open bundle; add tomatoes. Re-seal. Grill 20 to 30 minutes longer or until zucchini is tender and tomatoes are heated through.

title: 211. GRILLED VEGGIE DELIGHT
info:
GRILLED VEGGIE DELIGHT

ingredients

1 each red and yellow pepper, cored and sliced
1 red onion, peeled and sliced
1 zucchini, sliced lengthwise and quartered
1/4 lb. asparagus, trimmed
1 Tbsp. olive oil
1 Tbsp. lemon juice

preparation

Heat grill or oven to 375°. In bowl, combine vegetables. Add oil and lemon juice. Toss to coat evenly. Place vegetables on grill pan or roasting pan. Cook 20 minutes or until tender, turning occasionally. Season with sea salt and pepper, if desired.

title: 106. GRILLED CHEESE BREAD
info:
GRILLED CHEESE BREAD

ingredients

1 (1 lb.) loaf Italian bread
1/2 c. (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened
1/4 c. sun-dried tomatoes (in oil), drained
2 Tbsp. jarred pesto
1 clove garlic
1/4 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. black pepper
1 1/2 c. shredded Provolone cheese (6 oz.)

preparation

Heat grill. With serrated knife, slice bread lengthwise in half horizontally.

In food processor, pulse together butter, sun-dried tomatoes, pesto, garlic, salt and pepper until thoroughly combined and sun-dried tomatoes are chopped. Scrape into bowl. Stir in 1 cup shredded cheese.

Grill bread, cut side down, until toasted, about 1 1/2 minutes. Spread butter mixture onto cut side of each half, dividing equally. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Grill bread, cut side up, over indirect heat, with grill covered, until topping is melted, 8 to 10 minutes. Let cool slightly. With serrated knife, cut into slices. Serve warm. Grill: about 12 minutes.

title: 217. PILOT'S GRILL DIP
info:
PILOT'S GRILL DIP

ingredients

1/2 c. cheddar cheese shredded
1/2 c. cottage cheese
1/2 cup cream cheese
2 oz. pimentos
1 tsp. French dressing
1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2 tsp. garlic salt
1/2 tsp. onion salt
2 Tbsp. blue cheese

preparation

Mix all ingredients except blue cheese in blender. Crumble blue cheese and stir in last.

title: 156. GRILLED BURGERS
info:
GRILLED BURGERS

ingredients

1/4 c. sour cream
2 tsp. dried parsley flakes
1 tsp. dried thyme
1 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. pepper
2 1/2 lb. ground beef

preparation

In a large bowl, combine the first five ingredients; add beef and mix gently. Shape into 10 patties. Grill, uncovered, over medium coals for 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until meat is no longer pink. Serve on buns with lettuce, tomatoes and onion if desired. Yield: 10 servings.

title: 29. GRILLED FISH AND SHRIMP
info:
GRILLED FISH AND SHRIMP

ingredients

4 fish fillets
1 lb. large shrimp, cleaned
1/2 c. butter
juice of 2 lemons
1 or 2 cloves garlic, pressed
Greek seasoning
1 bell pepper
1/2 c. onion, chopped
1 tomato, chopped

preparation

Melt butter; add lemon juice and garlic and simmer 1 minute. Season fish and shrimp lightly with Greek seasoning. Place fish and shrimp in a large sheet of heavy foil with top loosely opened. Baste heavily with lemon butter and garlic sauce. Add chopped tomato, onion and green pepper. Place on an outdoor grill and cook about 5 minutes. This may be baked in oven with foil closed.

Scallops may be substituted for shrimp.

title: 212. OLIVIA'S FAVORITE GRILLED CHEESE
info:
OLIVIA'S FAVORITE GRILLED CHEESE

ingredients

2 slices bread
1 slice cheese
oleo

preparation

Put 1 tsp. oleo in frying pan (small). Melt oleo. Place slice of cheese between slices of bread. Put small amounts of oleo on top slice of bread. Put in fryer and brown on both sides.

title: 174. DIANE'S GRILLED SHRIMP
info:
DIANE'S GRILLED SHRIMP

ingredients

2 lb. shrimp, peeled (uncooked)
1 bottle Parmesan peppercorn salad dressing

preparation

Marinate shrimp with tails in salad dressing at least one hour. Turn or toss every 15 minutes. Either put shrimp on skewers or on a grilling pan. Cook on hot grill 10 minutes each side.

title: 154. GRILLED ROAST BEEF SANDWICHES
info:
GRILLED ROAST BEEF SANDWICHES

ingredients

1 lb. deli roast beef
1 sm. onion, sliced
fresh mushrooms
provolone or mozzarella cheese slices
white or wheat bread slices
butter or margarine
1 Tbsp. Dijon mustard
3 Tbsp. mayonnaise

preparation

Preheat skillet over medium heat and melt 2 tsp. of margarine. Sauté onions and mushrooms until golden. Next sauté slices of roost beef until darkened. Remove from pan. Mix mayonnaise & dijon together in small bowl. Spread mixture on inside of one slide of the bread. Layer 2 slices of roast beef then 2-3 slices of grilled onion and mushrooms. Add slice of cheese and 2 more slices of roast beef. Butter both sides of bread before grilling. Grill sandwich on medium heat until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted. (If individuals don't like any of the ingredients - they can be deleted.)

title: 283. GRILLED POTATO SKINS
info:
GRILLED POTATO SKINS
(Barbecue/Bake at 350~)

ingredients

6 large scrubbed potatoes
3 Tbsp. sunflower oil
1 tsp. garlic salt
1 tsp. chili powder
1 tsp. mixed (apple pie) spice
1 tsp. ground cumin
freshly ground black pepper

preparation

Bake potatoes at 350° about 1 hour until soft. Cut potatoes in half and scoop out potato, leaving a wall about 1/4-inch thick. Cut each half into 3 wedges. Brush all over with oil. Mix seasonings and sprinkle over skins. Place on a sheet of foil. Barbecue about 10 minutes, turning occasionally until crisp and golden.

title: 158. GRILLED PORK CHOPS
info:
GRILLED PORK CHOPS

ingredients

1 medium onion, finely chopped
1/2 c. water
1/2 c. soy sauce
1/3 c. packed brown sugar
1/4 c. lemon juice
1 garlic clove, minced (optional)
6 loin pork chops (about 1-inch thick)

preparation

In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the first six ingredients. Set aside 1/3 cup for basting; add pork chops to the remaining marinade. Seal and refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Drain and discard marinade. Grill chops, covered, over medium-hot heat for 4 minutes. Turn; baste with reserved marinade. Grill 4 to 7 minutes longer or until juices run clear. Yield: 6 servings.

title: 137. GRILLED VEGETABLE MARINADE
info:
GRILLED VEGETABLE MARINADE

ingredients

3/4 c vegetable oil
3/4 c lemon juice
2 tsp seasoned salt
2 tsp paprika
2 tsp sweet basil
2 tsp thyme
1/2 tsp garlic powder

preparation

Mix well and pour over mixed vegetables. Marinate several hours. Grill until vegetables are tender.

title: 290. GRILLED SIRLOIN & WILD RICE SALAD
info:
GRILLED SIRLOIN & WILD RICE SALAD

ingredients

1 (6 oz.) pkg. long grain & wild rice
1/2 c. lemon juice
1/3 c. olive oil
4 garlic cloves, pressed
salt and pepper to taste
1 lb. beef top sirloin steak, cut into 4 equal portions
1 (6 oz.) jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained, chopped
8 c. mixed salad greens, torn into bite-sized pieces

preparation

Preheat the grill. Prepare the rice using package directions. Cool to room temperature. Combine the lemon juice, olive oil and garlic in a small mixing bowl and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Reserve 1/4 c. of the olive oil mixture. Sprinkle the steaks with salt and pepper. Grill over medium-hot coals for 10 minutes for medium-rare, turning and basting once with the reserved olive oil mixture. Remove to a platter. Combine the remaining olive mixture, rice and artichokes in a large mixing bowl and toss lightly. Arrange the greens on 4 dinner plates. Top the greens with a mound of the rice mixture. Cut the steak into thin strips. Fan the steak strips on top of the rice mixture. Serve immediately.

title: 51. PINEAPPLE ON THE GRILL
info:
PINEAPPLE ON THE GRILL

ingredients

4 slices fresh pineapple
1/4 c. apricot preserves
shredded coconut

preparation

Place each pineapple slice on an 8-inch square of heavy-duty foil. Fill centers with 1 tablespoon preserves and coconut; fold into tight package. Heat on a preheated grill at low position for 10 minutes or until preserves have melted over pineapple. Makes 4 servings.

title: 113. BACON-TOMATO GRILLED CHEESE
info:
BACON-TOMATO GRILLED CHEESE

ingredients

8 slices sourdough bread
4 slices Mozzarella cheese
2 large tomatoes, thinly sliced
8 bacon strips, cooked
4 Tbsp. sour cream
4 Tbsp. finely chopped onion
1/4 tsp. dried oregano
4 slices Cheddar cheese
2 Tbsp. butter, softened

preparation

Top 1 slice of bread with 1 slice of Mozzarella cheese, 1/4 of the tomato slices, 2 bacon strips, 1 tablespoon sour cream, 1 tablespoon onion, a pinch of oregano, 1 slice of Cheddar cheese; then top with another bread slice. Spread melted butter on the outside.

On a hot griddle or heavy skillet, toast/grill sandwiches on both sides for 3 to 4 minutes.

title: 275. SESAME SEED GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
SESAME SEED GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

1/2 c. soy sauce
1/2 c. oil (vegetable or olive)
2 Tbsp. minced dried onion
2 Tbsp. sesame seeds
1/2 to 1 c. water
1 Tbsp. (rounded) brown sugar
1 tsp. ginger
1/2 tsp. minced garlic
1/2 tsp. red pepper
8 boneless skinless chicken breasts

preparation

Combine ingredients and marinate 12 hours. Grill approximately 1 hour or until done. Baste with the remaining marinade.

title: 17. ASSORTED GRILLED HAMBURGERS
info:
ASSORTED GRILLED HAMBURGERS

ingredients

1 1/2 lb. ground meat
3/4 tsp. salt
dash of pepper
1 tsp. monosodium glutamate

preparation

Lightly mix all ingredients and shape into 6 patties. Broil on grill over hot coals, turning once, about 10 minutes or until nicely browned.

Variations:

ingredients

1/4 c. commercial sour cream
1 Tbsp. minced parsley
1/8 tsp. oregano
3/4 tsp. garlic salt
2 Tbsp. chopped fresh mushrooms
1/4 tsp. ground ginger
1 tsp. soy sauce
1 tsp. sugar

preparation

Prepare as usual.

title: 79. GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH
info:
GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH

ingredients

Two slices of bread
One slice of cheese
Some butter

preparation

Melt butter in a pan. Put sandwich in the pan and put cheese in the middle and butter on the bread. Flip sandwich over when it is brown.

title: 183. GRILLED SIRLOIN STEAK
info:
GRILLED SIRLOIN STEAK

ingredients

1 c. soy sauce
1/4 c. red wine vinegar or cider vinegar
1/4 c. olive or vegetable oil
4 garlic cloves, chopped
1 Tbsp. pepper
1 Tbsp. ground ginger or 1/4 c. minced fresh ginger root
1 Tbsp. honey
1 boneless beef sirloin steak

preparation

In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the first seven ingredients; add beef. Seal bag and turn to coat; refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight. Drain and discard the marinade. Grill steak, covered, over indirect medium heat for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, turning once, or until meat reaches desired doneness.

title: 36. GRILLED STUFFED FRANKS
info:
GRILLED STUFFED FRANKS

ingredients

1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
1 Tbsp. sugar
2 Tbsp. spicy brown mustard
1/2 tsp. garlic powder
8 frankfurters
6 small green onions, chopped
8 slices bacon
8 hot dog buns

preparation

Combine tomato sauce, sugar, mustard and garlic powder. Stir well. Slice frankfurters lengthwise to make a pocket. Brush inside each pocket with sauce; sprinkle with onion. Wrap each frankfurter with bacon, securing with a toothpick (wooden). Cook frankfurters over hot coals 10 to 15 minutes or until bacon is crisp, turning often and basting with remaining sauce. Serve in hot dog buns. Serves 8.

title: 273. GRILLED STEAK WITH BALSAMIC VINEGAR
info:
GRILLED STEAK WITH BALSAMIC VINEGAR

ingredients

2 Ribeye or Porter steaks about 1 1/2 lb.
2 Tbsp. Balsamic vinegar
4 tsp. Mrs. Dash Original Steak Grilling Blend
2 Tbsp. Olive Oil

preparation

Mix vinegar, original steak grilling blend and olive oil in a small bowl. Coat both sides of steaks with the mixture. Let marinate in refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Preheat grill or broiler to medium heat. Place steaks on a large sheet of aluminum foil; seal foil. Grill or broil for 20 minutes. Open foil and remove steaks and place them over direct heat; reseal foil. Continue grilling for 3 minutes per side to desired doneness. Serve immediately. Top with juice from the foil.

Yields 4 Servings.

title: 240. GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN

White Sauce:

ingredients

1 qt Mayonnaise
1/3 c lemon juice
salt to taste (1 tsp or more)
pepper to taste (2 tsp or more)
sugar to taste (1 tsp or more)

preparation

Shake until blended well or use blender to mix. Enough for 2 or 3 chickens or 4-6 chicken halves. Cook 1-1/2 hours on the grill.

title: 230. GRILLED CHICKEN WITH CILANTRO BUTTER
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN WITH CILANTRO BUTTER

ingredients

4 fresh split chicken breasts
1 Tbsp. chopped garlic
1 tsp. salt, divided
1/2 tsp. pepper, divided
8 sprigs fresh cilantro
1/4 c. chopped cilantro
2 tsp. grated lime peel
1/4 c. butter, melted
2 Tbsp. olive oil
2 Tbsp. fresh lime juice

preparation

Preheat grill to medium heat. In small dish, combine garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Mash into a paste using back side of a large spoon. Add lime peel. Wash hands.

Loosen the skin of chicken by slipping your hand between the meat and skin. Spread a quarter of the garlic mixture and tuck 2 cilantro sprigs under the skin of each breast. Wash hands.

In small bowl, combine chopped cilantro, butter, oil and lime juice. Brush chicken skin lightly with mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Place chicken on grill, skin side down. Brush with cilantro-butter mixture. Cover and grill 15 minutes. Turn chicken; brush with half of remaining cilantro butter. Cover and grill 10 minutes. Without turning, brush chicken with remaining cilantro butter. Cover and grill 5 minutes or until internal juices of chicken run clear.

Temperature of meat thermometer should read 180°. Serve with Spanish rice and chilled fresh fruit, if desired. Refrigerate leftovers.

title: 249. GRILLED CHEESE LOAF
info:
GRILLED CHEESE LOAF

ingredients

1 3 oz. pkg cream cheese softened
2 tbsp. butter or margarine, softened
1 cup (4 oz.) shredded mozzarella cheese
1/4 cup chopped green onion with tops
1/2 tsp garlic salt
1 loaf (1 pound) french bread sliced

preparation

In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and butter. Add cheese, onions, garlic salt; mix well. Spread on both sides of each slice of bread. Wrap loaf in a large piece of heavy duty foil. Seal tightly. Grill, covered over medium coals for 8 - 10 minutes turning once. Unwrap foil; grill 5 minutes longer. Yield 10 -12 servings.

title: 38. TURKEY BURGERS ON THE GRILL
info:
TURKEY BURGERS ON THE GRILL

ingredients

1 lb. ground uncooked turkey
1/4 c. dry bread crumbs
2 Tbsp. finely minced onion
1/2 tsp. ground sage
1 tsp. prepared horseradish (more horseradish can be used)

preparation

Mix ingredients and shape into patties. This can be used with hamburger or can be made into a loaf.

title: 233. SUNDOWN'S GRILLED PORK TENDERLOIN
info:
SUNDOWN'S GRILLED PORK TENDERLOIN

ingredients

pork tenderloin, trimmed of sinew and excess fat

preparation

Allow 6 to 8 ounces per person.

Marinade:

ingredients

1/2 c. pureed garlic
1/4 c. ground black pepper
1 Tbsp. fresh thyme leaves, coarsely chopped
1 c. sherry vinegar
1/2 c. honey

preparation

Mix all ingredients and marinate overnight or at least 4 hours, covered, in refrigerator.

Prepare grill for cooking (hickory or pecan wood adds flavor). Char-grill meat to medium. Grill whole and slice at serving time. Place Georgia Peach Sauce on plate and arrange pork slices on top of sauce.

Georgia Peach Sauce For Pork Tenderloin:

ingredients

1 onion, sliced in 1/8 half moons
2 sprigs fresh thyme
1 c. white wine (may omit)
4 peaches, peeled, pitted and chopped
1 c. honey
1 pt. chicken broth
10 Tbsp. unsalted butter, softened
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until softened. Add a generous pinch of salt and fresh thyme, cooking until aromatic. Increase heat to high. Add wine and continue cooking until wine is reduced by 2/3. Add peaches. When peaches are heated through, add chicken stock and honey. Cook until peaches are falling apart and liquid is somewhat thickened and reduced (about the consistency of applesauce). Remove thyme sprig and transfer contents of pot into the blender. Blend until quite smooth. Return contents to pot and over medium to medium-high heat, whisk in softened 8 tablespoons of butter. Season to taste. Yield: 8 portions.

title: 232. GRILLED BASS AND VEGETABLES
info:
GRILLED BASS AND VEGETABLES

ingredients

bass fillets
green peppers
onions
tomatoes
grated Mozzarella cheese
dried hot pepper
herbal salt substitute

preparation

Secret for "barbecuing" ribs without burning (no small trick) is to cover grill with foil. To keep them juicy, baste with beer, water or broth. The finishing touch is to baste ribs with spicy barbecue sauce until they are glazed. This combined with the charcoal flavor makes them irresistible.

Note: See sauces for tasty spicy barbecue sauce.

title: 142. GRILLED CHEESE (WITH A TWIST)
info:
GRILLED CHEESE (WITH A TWIST)

ingredients

loaf of bread
slice of American cheese
thinly sliced tomato
crispy fried bacon

preparation

Spread a small amount of mayonnaise on one slice of bread. Add bacon, tomato and cheese. Put another piece on top to make sandwich.

I use mayo spread on both "outside" pieces and grill on nonstick pan. You can use melted butter or spray with Pam. Cook on both sides and serve hot!

title: 179. GRILLED HONEY-BOURBON SALMON
info:
GRILLED HONEY-BOURBON SALMON

ingredients

2 - 6 to 8 oz. fresh or frozen salmon steaks, cut 1 inch thick
6 Tbsp. bourbon whiskey
1/4 C. brown sugar, packed
1 Tbsp. honey
1 tsp. soy sauce
1/4 tsp. ground ginger
1/8 tsp. pepper
Cooking oil or cooking spray for grill rack

preparation

Thaw salmon if frozen. Rinse fish, pat dry, place in plastic bag set in a shallow baking dish. In a small bowl, stir together bourbon, brown sugar, honey, soy sauce, ginger and pepper. Pour over fish in bag. Close bag. Marinate fish in refrigerator one hour, turning occasionally. Drain fish, reserving marinade. Coat rack with oil or spray. Place fish on rack of uncovered grill directly over medium heat. Grill 8 to 12 minutes or until fish begins to flake easily with fork, turning once. Brush once with reserved marinade half-way through grilling time. Discard remaining marinade. Serves: 2.

title: 295. GRILLED LEMON CHICKEN
info:
GRILLED LEMON CHICKEN

ingredients

zest of 1 lemon
2 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice
1 c. sliced green onion
1 Tbsp. chopped fresh parsley
1 Tbsp. chopped fresh or 1 tsp. dried basil
6 (4 oz.) skinless boneless chicken breast

preparation

Combine first 6 ingredients in Ziploc bag. Add chicken and turn to coat. Marinate in refrigerator at least 2 hours, turning occasionally. Discard marinade. Place on sprayed grill over medium hot coals until done.

title: 93. BRISKET ON THE GRILL
info:
BRISKET ON THE GRILL

ingredients

1 12 to 14 lb. brisket
1 onion, diced
1 sweet pepper, diced
1 Tbsp. butter
2 c. Worcestershire Sauce, Heinz 57 Sauce, A-1 Steak Sauce (leftovers, any combination)

preparation

Sauté onion and pepper in butter until golden brown. Marinate the brisket in the 2 cups of sauces in a large pan in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Remove from refrigerator. Leave in same pan, just add sautéed vegetables on top and cover with foil. Bake for 4 hours in oven. Then place on covered grill for 2 hours. You can use charcoal, but natural wood coals work best.

title: 74. GRILLED CATFISH WITH SALSA
info:
GRILLED CATFISH WITH SALSA

ingredients

6 catfish fillets
1/3 c. lime juice
1/4 c. olive oil
1/8 tsp. salt

preparation

Mix ingredients and pour over fillets. Marinate at least 15 minutes. Brush grill with salad oil and grill catfish over medium-hot coals for 7 to 8 minutes per side. Spoon salsa over fish and serve.

Salsa:

ingredients

4 large tomatoes, diced
1 white onion, diced
1 or 2 serrano or jalapeno peppers, seeded and diced
1 clove garlic, crushed
1/4 c. cilantro, minced
2 Tbsp. fresh lime juice
1/2 tsp. cumin
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Mix all ingredients together and allow to set for at least one hour.

title: 83. SINALOA STYLE GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
SINALOA STYLE GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

1/2 c. white vinegar
1/2 c. vinegar, flavored with parsley and black pepper
1/2 c. water
2 cloves garlic, crushed and chopped
1/2 tsp. salt
1 Tbsp. chili powder
1/2 tsp. oregano (dried)
1/2 tsp. black pepper
1 bay leaf, crumbled
1 chicken, cut into pieces

preparation

Combine vinegar, water, garlic, salt, chili powder, oregano, pepper and bay leaf. Wash chicken and pat dry. Place chicken in shallow baking dish and marinate. Cover and refrigerate 3 hours, turning once. Bring to room temperature for grilling. Drain from marinade. Cook over hot coals 20 to 30 minutes, basting occasionally. Serve with homemade salsa and tortillas.

title: 177. GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

3 1/2 to 4 lbs. chicken pieces, skinned
1 c. white or red wine vinegar
1/2 c. vegetable oil
2 Tbsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
2 Tbsp. poultry seasoning

preparation

Place chicken in a dish or heavy duty zip top plastic bag. Combine vinegar and remaining ingredients; pour marinade over chicken. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours, turning occasionally. Remove from marinade, discarding marinade. Grill covered, over hot coals 30 to 40 minutes or until done, turning frequently.

title: 264. PEANUT BUTTER CHICKEN FOR GRILLING
info:
PEANUT BUTTER CHICKEN FOR GRILLING

ingredients

boneless skinless chicken breast (1 piece per person)
1/2 c. hot water
1/2 c. creamy peanut butter
1/4 c. chili sauce
1/4 c. soy sauce
4 cloves minced garlic
1/2 tsp. ground ginger
1/4 tsp. red pepper

preparation

Rinse chicken and pat dry with paper towels. Mix marinade as follows. Stir hot water into a small bowl with the peanut butter (mixture will stiffen at first). Stir in the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Place chicken in a plastic bag in a shallow bowl. Pour marinade over the chicken and seal the bag, turning it so that all chicken pieces are covered. Chill for 12 to 24 hours. Drain off marinade and discard. Grill chicken over medium hot coals, 35 to 45 minutes until done. Serve with salsa or fresh fruit or any bottled fruit salsa.

title: 246. GRILLED POLENTA
info:
GRILLED POLENTA

ingredients

1/2 oz. butter (unsalted)
1/2 oz. garlic, chopped fine
1 1/2 qt. vegetable stock
12 oz. tomato juice (optional)*
12 oz. cornmeal
1/2 tsp. salt
1/3 tsp. peppercorns (black), cracked

preparation

Heat the butter; add the garlic and saut until the aroma is released. Add the stock to the pot. Add the cornmeal in a thin stream, whipping constantly to prevent the cornmeal from forming lumps. Continue to whip until the mixture is smooth and cook for 20 to 25 minutes or until the polenta is very thick. Stir the polenta frequently as it cooks. Cover a sheet pan with plastic wrap. Pour the finished polenta onto the sheet pan and level it with a spatula. Cover it with a sheet of parchment paper so that a skin will not form. Cool the polenta to room temperature and then chill under refrigeration. Slice the polenta or cut out into the desired shape (3.5 oz./100 gm per order). Lightly coat with cornmeal before grilling to prevent sticking to grill bars. Grill the polenta on a hot grill just before serving. If necessary, finish reheating the polenta in the oven. Yield: 1/2 hotel pan.

*Note: If tomato juice is omitted, replace moisture with additional vegetable stock.

title: 219. GRILLED CHICKEN FRUIT SALAD
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN FRUIT SALAD

ingredients

1 chicken breast
2 c. red seedless grapes, halved
1/2 c. of celery, chopped
1/4 c. onion, chopped
1/2 c. mayonnaise
1 Tbsp. of Dijon mustard
1/2 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. pepper
1 tsp. lemon juice
2 tsp. walnuts, finely chopped

preparation

Lightly coat the grill with cooking spray and preheat for 5 minutes. Grill the chicken for 5-7 minutes. Cool and cut into small cubes. In a large salad bowl, combine the chicken, grapes, celery, onion, and walnuts. Mix together the mayonnaise, mustard, salt, pepper and lemon juice to make dressing. Pour over the chicken salad and toss lightly.

title: 265. LEMON CHICKEN-GRILLED
info:
LEMON CHICKEN-GRILLED

ingredients

1/2 c. oil
juice from 2 lemons
1/2 lemon rind, quartered
1 stick butter
3/4 c. vinegar
2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/4 c. salt

preparation

Mix all together, except Worcestershire sauce and salt. Cook slow, then add Worcestershire sauce and salt. After chicken is tender, brush on while still cooking on the grill.

title: 117. GRILLED HAWAIIAN CHICKEN
info:
GRILLED HAWAIIAN CHICKEN

ingredients

2 Tbsp. unsweetened pineapple juice
3/4 c. finely chopped pineapple
2 Tbsp. chopped red bell pepper
2 Tbsp. minced cilantro leaves
1 1/2 tsp. white wine vinegar
1/2 tsp. pepper
1/4 tsp. salt
4 (4 oz.) chicken breast halves, skinned
1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped
1 tsp. unsweetened orange juice
pineapple leaves (as garnish)

preparation

Combine unsweetened pineapple juice and salt in a shallow dish; mix well. Add chicken, turning to coat. Cover and refrigerate chicken for several hours, turning occasionally.

Combine pineapple, bell pepper, jalapeno, cilantro, vinegar and orange juice in a small bowl; mix well. Let mixture stand at room temperature for 2 hours. Remove chicken from dish, reserving marinade. Sprinkle chicken with pepper.

Grill chicken 4 to 5-inches from coals for 15 minutes or until done, turning and basting frequently with reserved marinade.

To serve, top each breast with 3 tablespoons pineapple mixture. Garnish with pineapple leaves. Serves 4.

title: 244. GRILLED POTATOES
info:
GRILLED POTATOES

ingredients

2 large baking potatoes
2 tsp. margarine
2 tsp. grated Parmesan cheese
1/2 tsp. chopped chives
dash of garlic powder
1 small onion, sliced thinly

preparation

Preheat oven to 400°. Scrub potatoes. Cut in half crosswise. Cut slits crosswise into potatoes 3/4-inch apart, leaving bottom edge intact. Set aside.

Combine next 4 ingredients. Mix well. Divide mixture evenly and place into slit potatoes. Place onion slices into slits.

Wrap potatoes in foil. Bake at 400° for 45 minutes or until done.

title: 109. Grilled Jalapeno Peppers
info:
Grilled Jalapeno Peppers

ingredients

Jalapenos
Cream cheese
Bacon

preparation

Slice jalapenos lengthwise; stuff with cream cheese. Wrap with bacon and wrap in foil. Place on grill until bacon is done.

title: 87. GRILLED SALMON FILLETS
info:
GRILLED SALMON FILLETS
(Easy; See Marinade Variations)

ingredients

2 Tbsp. vegetable oil (plus extra for grill grate)
2 Tbsp. grated fresh ginger
1 1/2 tsp. ground cumin
1 1/2 tsp. ground coriander
1 1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper
4 center-cut salmon fillets (each about 6 oz. and 1 1/2-inches thick), pin bones removed
Mango Chutney (recipe follows)

preparation

Make a marinade by mixing 2 tablespoons oil, ginger, cumin, coriander, salt and cayenne together in large shallow bowl. Add fish and marinate in the refrigerator for no more than 30 minutes. Meanwhile, build a single-level fire. Set grill rack in place. Cover grill with lid and let rack heat up, about 5 minutes. Rub cooking grate with oil-dipped wad of paper towels.

If using a gas grill, preheat grill by turning all burners to high and closing lid until very hot, about 15 minutes.

Place fillets skin side down on grill grate; grill until skin shrinks and separates from flesh and turns black, 2 to 3 minutes. (If using a gas grill, cook with lid down for 3 to 4 minutes per side.) Flip fillets gently with long-handled tongs or spatula; grill until fillets are opaque throughout, yet translucent at very center when checked with the tip of a paring knife, about 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer to platter and serve with chutney. Makes 4 servings.

Mango Chutney: Peel, pit and cut a large mango into 1/2-inch dice. Combine mango with 3 tablespoons lemon juice and 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves.

Variations: Prepare a different marinade for the salmon and omit the chutney.

Soy-Lemon Marinade:

ingredients

1/3 c. soy sauce
1 tsp. grated lemon zest
1/4 c. fresh lemon juice
2 Tbsp. olive oil
2 cloves minced garlic
2 tsp. Dijon mustard
2 tsp. sesame oil
1 Tbsp. minced fresh herbs (such as parsley, basil, rosemary and thyme)

preparation

Mix all ingredients together. Marinate salmon fillets or 1 1/2-inch cubes of salmon for about 1 hour.

If using cubes, skewer them with vegetables (such as red bell pepper, red onion, zucchini and mushrooms) and grill them for about 8 minutes.

Dill-Lemon Marinade:

ingredients

1/4 c. white wine
finely shredded zest and juice of 1 lemon
1/3 c. finely chopped fresh dill
1 Tbsp. kosher salt
1 1/2 tsp. freshly ground pepper

preparation

Mix all ingredients. Pour over salmon fillets. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes. Brush fillets or steaks with olive oil before grilling.

title: 110. Grilled Mushrooms
info:
Grilled Mushrooms

ingredients

Fresh mushrooms
Garlic Salt
Cayenne Pepper
seasoned salt
butter
velveeta cheese

preparation

Take a whole clean mushroom and wrap with foil and place on grill for 15 minutes. Open and drain liquid. Season with garlic salt, season salt and cayenne pepper. Place pats of butter and Velveeta on each. Rewrap and place back on grill.

title: 115. GRILLED HONEY BURGERS
info:
GRILLED HONEY BURGERS

ingredients

1/2 c. honey
1/4 tsp. each: cinnamon, paprika and curry powder
1/8 tsp. ginger
1/8 tsp. nutmeg
1/4 c. soy sauce
1 large can sliced pineapple, drained
2 lb. ground beef
8 hamburger buns, split and lightly toasted
lettuce leaves

preparation

In a bowl, combine honey, cinnamon, paprika, curry powder, ginger and nutmeg. Add beef and mix well. Shape into 8 (3/4-inch) thick patties. Grill, uncovered, over medium heat for 3 minutes on each side; brush with soy sauce. Continue cooking for several minutes until juices run clear, basting and turning several times. During last few minutes, grill pineapple slices until lightly browned, turning once.

Serve burgers and pineapple slices on buns with lettuce. These can easily be cooked on stove top in a skillet if you don't want to grill.

title: 193. GRILLED SALMON WITH SHERRY VINEGAR HONEY GLAZE
info:
GRILLED SALMON WITH SHERRY VINEGAR HONEY GLAZE

ingredients

1 c. sherry vinegar
2 Tbsp. Dijon mustard
1/4 c. honey
1 Tbsp. chili powder
salt and pepper
4 (6 oz.) salmon fillets

preparation

In a small saucepan, reduce the vinegar to 1/4 cup. In a mixing bowl, combine vinegar syrup with mustard, honey and chili powder. Let rest 30 minutes. Preheat grill. Brush salmon with glaze and grill 3 minutes per side for medium.

title: 26. GRILLED CATFISH
info:
GRILLED CATFISH

ingredients

6 cleaned catfish (1 to 1 1/2 lb.)
1 stick margarine, melted
juice of 6 lemons
dash of Tabasco sauce
1 tsp. prepared mustard
2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. pepper
1 tsp. paprika

preparation

After coals have burned, place fish on grill. Combine all ingredients for basting sauce and baste frequently as fish cooks. Cook for 20 minutes on one side; turn and cook an additional 15 minutes, basting often.

title: 215. PEACHY DESSERT OFF THE GRILL
info:
PEACHY DESSERT OFF THE GRILL

ingredients

3 to 4 medium, ripe bananas
3 to 4 medium peaches
1/4 cup honey
2 Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon
1-10 3/4 frozen loaf pound cake, cut into ten 3/4 inch slices
1 - 8 oz. container whipped topping
1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon
1/8 tsp. ground nutmeg

preparation

Cut bananas and peaches into bite size pieces. Place fruit in a foil pan or make your own pan with heavy duty foil. In a bowl, stir together honey, butter and 1/2 tsp. cinnamon. Spoon over fruit and toss to coat fruit.

Cook the fruit over medium coals for 8 to 10 minutes or till heated through, stirring often. This may be done in oven also.

Serve the warm fruit over the slices of pound cake. Stir together the whipped topping with cinnamon and nutmeg. Dollop the mixture on top of each serving. Makes 10 servings.

NOTE: If fresh peaches aren't available, use one 16 oz. pkg. of frozen peach slices, thawed and drained.

title: 121. GRILLED TURKEY TENDERLOIN
info:
GRILLED TURKEY TENDERLOIN

ingredients

1/4 c. low-sodium soy sauce
1/4 c. sherry wine or apple juice
1/8 tsp. black pepper
2 Tbsp. crushed onion
1/4 c. peanut oil
2 Tbsp. lemon juice
1/8 tsp. garlic salt
1/4 tsp. ground ginger
1 lb. uncooked turkey tenderloin (about 1-inch thick)

preparation

In a shallow pan, blend all marinade ingredients together. Add turkey, turning to coat both sides. Cover. Marinate in the refrigerator several hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Grill the tenderloins over hot coals 8 to 10 minutes per side, depending on the thickness. Tenderloins are done when there is no pink in the center. Do not overcook. Serve in 1/4-inch thick slices in toasted buns. Yields 4 servings.

title: 34. GRILLED LONDON BROIL
info:
GRILLED LONDON BROIL

ingredients

London Broil steak
1 Kraft Zesty Italian dressing

preparation

Place London Broil in large casserole or container with lid. Pierce meat with fork all over and pour bottle of dressing on and cover overnight. Put more fork marks in to make sure it is completely marinated. Place on hot grill approximately 20 minutes. Should be medium rare. Slice thin to serve.

title: 164. CAMPFIRE GRILLED ONIONS
info:
CAMPFIRE GRILLED ONIONS

ingredients

4 large sweet onions
1/4 C. honey
1/8 tsp. pepper
1/4 C. margarine
1 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. garlic salt

preparation

Cut onions into wedges. Mix remaining ingredients and pour over onions. Put on thick foil or double layer foil. Fold foil to seal packet tightly. Grill, covered over medium hot heat for 20 minutes or until onions are tender, turning once.

title: 125. GRILLED PIZZA WITH RED PEPPERS AND CHEESE
info:
GRILLED PIZZA WITH RED PEPPERS AND CHEESE
(Makes 4 Servings)

ingredients

1/2 lb. pizza dough
1 Tbsp. olive oil
2 roasted red peppers, sliced
4 whole black olives, pitted and sliced
4 oz. Feta cheese, crumbled
pinch of kosher salt or sea salt
freshly ground black pepper
2 Tbsp. fresh oregano leaves

preparation

Spray the grill grate with nonstick spray and preheat the grill to medium.

Roll out the pizza dough with a rolling pin or use your hands to pat the dough into a circle about 12 to 14-inches across and 1/4-inch thick.

Lightly drizzle one side of the dough with some of the olive oil and carefully place the dough, oil side down, on the grill. Lightly drizzle the other side of the dough with more of the olive oil (the side facing up). When the dough is golden brown on one side, turn it over using a long spatula.

Arrange the roasted red peppers, olives and Feta cheese on top of the pizza. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and the remaining olive oil. Place the cover on the grill and cook until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.

Using a long spatula or 2 smaller ones, remove the pizza from the grill and sprinkle the oregano leaves over the top. Cut into slices and serve. Preparation time: 20 minutes. Cooking time: 15 minutes.

title: 252. PASTA SALAD WITH TOMATOES AND GRILLED SALMON
info:
PASTA SALAD WITH TOMATOES AND GRILLED SALMON

ingredients

12 oz. Penne Pasta
3 Tbsp. Olive Oil
3 Tbsp. Garlic and Herb Seasoning Blend
3 Tbsp. Lemon Juice
2 medium tomatoes, peeled, seeded and diced
1 Pint cherry tomatoes, halved, yellow if possible
1 large cucumber, peeled, seeded and diced
1 red pepper
2 yellow peppers
6-4oz. Salmon fillets, grilled

preparation

Cook pasta according to package directions, Set aside. Roast peppers, cool, peel and dice. Combine olive oil, herb seasoning and lemon juice in a large bowl. Add prepared vegetables and pasta, toss well and chill. When ready to serve, brush salmon fillets with a little olive oil and sprinkle lightly with seasoning blend. Grill fillets 3-4 minutes per side on medium heat. Serve hot with pasta salad.

Serves 6.

title: 95. CITRUS AND ROSEMARY GRILLED PORK
info:
CITRUS AND ROSEMARY GRILLED PORK

ingredients

1/4 c. dark molasses
3 Tbsp. balsamic vinegar
3 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil
2 Tbsp. (approximately 3 sprigs) fresh rosemary leaves, finely chopped
1 navel orange, zested
4 boneless center cut pork chops, cut 1-inch thick
1 bottle Montreal steak seasoning
coarse salt
black pepper

preparation

To make marinade, combine first 5 ingredients in a bowl with a whisk or a fork. Pat chops dry with paper towels and rub on seasonings of salt and pepper. Turn chops in marinade and let stand 15 minutes.

Season chops with Montreal seasoning. Grill chops on indoor electric grill preheated to high for 6 to 7 minutes on each side or pan-fry over medium-high heat for same amount of time under a loose tinfoil tent in a nonstick skillet. Serve chops with Sun-Dried Tomatoes and Potatoes found under vegetable section.

title: 86. MARINATED GRILLED CHICKEN BREAST
info:
MARINATED GRILLED CHICKEN BREAST

ingredients

3/4 c. soy sauce
2 Tbsp. corn oil
2 Tbsp. brown sugar
1 tsp. paprika
1 tsp. garlic powder
1 tsp. black pepper
6 to 8 boneless chicken breasts

preparation

Mix first six ingredients to make the marinade. Wash the boneless skinless chicken breasts, then place in suitable covered container. Pour in marinade, then let marinate 4 hours or better overnight. Grill 4 to 6 minutes on each side or until done.

title: 80. GRILLED CHICKEN SALAD
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN SALAD

ingredients

1/4 c. grape seed oil or olive oil
3 Tbsp. balsamic vinegar
1 Tbsp. dried dill weed
1 large clove garlic, minced
1/4 tsp. freshly ground black pepper
1/4 tsp. dried oregano, crushed
4 medium skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
Montreal or Kansas City steak seasoning
8 c. mesclun or spring salad greens or spinach
3/4 c. seedless red grapes, halved
1/3 c. crumbled goat cheese
1/4 c. pine nuts, toasted

preparation

For vinaigrette, in a screw-top jar, combine oil, vinegar, dill weed, garlic, pepper and oregano. Cover and shake well. Let stand 1 hour.

Meanwhile, sprinkle chicken breast halves lightly with steak seasoning. Grill chicken on the rack of an uncovered grill directly over medium coals for 12 to 15 minutes or until tender and no longer pink (170°), turning once. Cool slightly.

Arrange salad greens on 4 plates. Top with grapes, goat cheese and pine nuts. Slice each chicken breast and arrange one sliced breast on each salad. Shake dressing and drizzle over the salads. Makes 4 servings.

title: 139. GRILLED FRENCH BREAD ROLLS
info:
GRILLED FRENCH BREAD ROLLS

ingredients

3/4 cup olive oil
6 garlic cloves, flattened
18 large French Bread Rolls
pepper

preparation

Heat olive oil in a heavy medium skillet over medium low heat. Add garlic and cook until light brown, about 4 minutes. Discard garlic. Prepare barbecue (high heat). Split rolls in half horizontally. Brush cut surfaces with garlic oil; sprinkle generously with pepper. Grill rolls, oil side down, until golden brown. Serve hot or at room temperature.

title: 120. TURKEY ON THE GRILL
info:
TURKEY ON THE GRILL

ingredients

stick butter
c. vinegar
tsp. salt
Tbsp. crushed red pepper
tsp. black pepper

preparation

Heat grill to about 350°. Place turkey in pan with 1/2-inch sides; salt and pepper the whole turkey. Put about 1/8 to 1/4-inch water in pan. Place in grill with cover closed and let the water cook off. Do not open the grill for the first hour.

Heat the butter, vinegar, salt, red pepper and black pepper in a saucepan on the stove. Baste the turkey every 30 minutes after the first hour. Grilling time approximately 3 hours.

For a crisp turkey, do not cover with foil. Enjoy!!!

title: 206. RIC'S GRILLED TILAPIA
info:
RIC'S GRILLED TILAPIA

ingredients

tilapia (allow 2 fillets per person)
badia mojo marinade
slices of lemon
red potatoes, cut into small cubes
red onion, chopped
fish seasoning (Emeril's fish rub or Chef Paul Prudhomme's Seafood Magic)
any or all of the following: carrots, chopped small, broccoli, chopped small, summer squash or peppers (red are great!)

preparation

You will also need aluminum foil for grilling.

On a large piece of foil, place fish fillets. Brush generously with marinade and sprinkle with fish seasoning. Place veggies on top and around fish as desired. Add several lemon slices on top and sprinkle with more marinade and 2 tablespoons water. Fold up foil and crimp top to make a leak-proof pouch around fish and veggies. Mark each pouch with marker to personalize the meal.

Turn gas grill to low and place pouches on top rack of grill. Close lid and cook for approximately 20 minutes. Cooking times may vary according to your grill.

title: 247. GRILLED CHEESE LOAF
info:
GRILLED CHEESE LOAF

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese (soft)
2 Tbsp. butter (soft)
1 c. shredded Mozzarella
1/4 c. chopped green onions
1/2 tsp. garlic powder
1 loaf French bread, sliced

preparation

Beat cream cheese and butter. Add cheese, onions and garlic. Mix well. Spread on each side of each slice of bread. Wrap in foil and put on grill 8 to 10 minutes. Turn once. Unwrap and grill 5 more minutes. (Can bake in oven.)

title: 99. PINK LEMONADE GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
PINK LEMONADE GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

8 chicken breasts
1 (12 oz.) can frozen pink lemonade concentrate, thawed
2/3 c. soy sauce
1/4 tsp. garlic powder

preparation

Mix lemonade, soy and garlic. Marinate chicken in mixture. Refrigerate overnight. Cook chicken on charcoal grill for 15 minutes or until done. Serves 8.

title: 197. GRILLED SALMON WITH SALSA PICANTE
info:
GRILLED SALMON WITH SALSA PICANTE

ingredients

4 salmon steaks (5 to 6 oz. each)
juice of 2 limes
3/4 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. freshly ground black pepper
1 Tbsp. olive oil
1 c. Salsa Picante (recipe included following)

preparation

Place salmon steaks in a shallow pan. Sprinkle both sides with the lime juice, salt and pepper. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and let marinate for 30 minutes, at room temperature.

Meanwhile, light up the grill! Brush olive oil over the salmon and grill or broil about 4 inches from the heat, turning once, about 6 minutes per side. Salmon should brown nicely on the outside and appear opaque but still juicy in the center.

Salsa Picante:

ingredients

2 c. medium red bell peppers or 1 jar roasted red peppers (7 oz.)
2 cans diced green chilies, drained
6 scallions, finely chopped
1/4 c. tiny capers, rinsed and drained
1/2 c. chopped parsley
2 tsp. fresh oregano, chopped
2 Tbsp. fresh lime juice
2 Tbsp. virgin olive oil
1/4 tsp. salt
1 tsp. fresh chopped garlic

preparation

Roast the peppers until skins are charred over grill. Or broil close to flame in oven. Let pepper stand for five minutes. Rub off charred skin and remove stem. Remove seeds and dice pepper to 1/4-inch dices. Combine all other ingredients with diced pepper. Mix well. Serve over salmon fillets.

title: 58. GRILLED PEACH HALVES
info:
GRILLED PEACH HALVES

ingredients

1 (1 lb. 14 oz.) can cling peaches (halves) or fresh ones
1/4 c. butter or margarine, melted

preparation

Preheat griddle. Drain peaches; place on paper towels to absorb excess juices. Brush peaches with butter. Grill hollow side down 1 1/2 minutes or until lightly browned. Turn and grill 1 1/2 minutes longer. If desired, fill centers with jelly or cranberry sauce.

A nice garnish for chicken or turkey.

title: 134. GRILLED MUSHROOMS
info:
GRILLED MUSHROOMS

ingredients

1/2 lb. whole fresh mushrooms (medium size work best)
1/4 c. butter or margarine, melted
1/2 tsp. dill weed
1/2 tsp. garlic salt

preparation

Thread mushrooms on skewers. Combine butter, dill and garlic salt; brush over mushrooms. Grill over hot coals for 10-15 minutes, basting and turning every 5 minutes.

title: 39. ITALIAN GRILLED SIRLOIN STEAK
info:
ITALIAN GRILLED SIRLOIN STEAK

ingredients

6 sliced sirloin tips (very thin)
1 can stewed tomatoes, drained
1 green pepper, diced (optional)
1 pkg. Mozzarella cheese, grated
1/2 c. Italian bread crumbs
1/2 c. Romano and Parmesan cheese, mixed
dash of garlic powder

preparation

Put stewed tomatoes, green pepper and Mozzarella cheese in a bowl and mix together. Put about a tablespoon (or more) on each steak, then roll steak. In another bowl mix Italian bread crumbs, Romano and Parmesan cheese and garlic powder. Dip and roll steak in this mixture. You might need toothpicks to hold together. Cook on grill in foil until steak is done. You can pound steak to make it thin or have it sliced very thin. Serves 6.

title: 124. Grilled Garlic Tenderloin
info:
Grilled Garlic Tenderloin

ingredients

3 Tbsp. olive oil
1 Tbsp. white wine vinegar
2 tsp. chopped rosemary
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
2 cloves garlic, crushed
2 (3/4 lb.) pork tenderloins

preparation

Combine first 6 ingredients; stir well. Place tenderloins in a 12 x 8 x 2-inch dish; brush olive oil mixture over all sides of tenderloins. Cover and chill 3 hours. Grill tenderloins, covered, over hot coals 12 to 15 minutes or until meat thermometer reads 160°, turning once. Cut into slices to serve.

title: 157. GRILLED ITALIAN CHICKEN
info:
GRILLED ITALIAN CHICKEN

ingredients

1 (8 oz.) bottle Italian salad dressing
3 Tbsp. teriyaki sauce
8 boneless skinless chicken breast halves

preparation

In a bowl, combine salad dressing and teriyaki sauce. Remove 1/4 cup for basting; cover and refrigerate. Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag; add remaining marinade. Seal bag and turn to coat; refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Drain and discard marinade. Grill chicken, covered, over medium heat for 3 minutes on each side. Baste with reserved marinade. Grill 3 to 4 minutes longer on each side or until juices run clear. Yield: 6 servings.

title: 202. Grilled Salmon with Ginger Orange Mustard Glaze
info:
Grilled Salmon with Ginger Orange Mustard Glaze
(Yield: 4 Servings)

ingredients

1/4 cup Fresh Orange Juice
1/4 cup Tamari or Soy Sauce
4 (6 oz.) Salmon Fillets (about 1-inch thick)
1/4 cup Cream Sherry
1/4 cup Dijon Mustard
1 Tbsp. Grated Peeled Fresh Ginger
2 Tbsp. Honey
Cooking Spray
Green Onion, for garnish
Lemon Slices, for garnish

preparation

1. Combine first 6 ingredients in a large zip-lock bag. Add fish to bag, seal and marinate in oven refrigerator for 30+ minutes.

2. Remove fish from bag and reserve marinade.

3. Prepare grill and place fish on grill coated with cooking spray. Cook approximately 5 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Baste frequently with reserved marinade while cooking.

4. Place remaining marinade in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Serve over fish and garnish with onions and lemon.

- This dish is excellent served with rice and the sauce served over both. Calories: 375.

title: 176. HONEY-GRILLED TENDERLOINS
info:
HONEY-GRILLED TENDERLOINS

ingredients

2 (3/4 lb.) pork tenderloins
1/4 c. lite soy sauce
5 garlic cloves, minced
1/2 tsp. ground ginger
2 Tbsp. brown sugar
3 Tbsp. honey
2 tsp. dark sesame oil

preparation

Make a lengthwise cut down center of each tenderloin to within 1/4-inch of opposite side; press to open. Combine soy sauce, garlic and ginger in a shallow dish. Add tenderloins. Cover or seal and chill 3 hours, turning occasionally. Stir together brown sugar, honey and oil. Grill tenderloins covered with grill lid over medium-high heat (350° to 400°) 20 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted into thickest portion registers 160°, turning occasionally and basting with honey mixture. Yield: 6 servings.

Prep: 10 minutes. Chill: 3 hours. Grill: 20 minutes.

title: 56. GRILLED ONION-POTATOES
info:
GRILLED ONION-POTATOES

ingredients

6 medium baking potatoes
8 Tbsp. butter
1 envelope dry onion soup mix

preparation

Scrub potatoes; cut each into 1/2-inch thick slices. Blend butter and onion soup mix; spread on one side of each potato slice. Reassemble potatoes; wrap each in foil, sealing well. Bake on grill over coals for 45 minutes or until done, turning once.

title: 204. GRILLED SWORDFISH STEAKS WITH PESTO
info:
GRILLED SWORDFISH STEAKS WITH PESTO

ingredients

1 lb. swordfish steaks
1 cup prepared pesto sauce

preparation

Baste fish with pesto sauce. Grill 10 minutes total per inch of thickness, approximately 5 minutes per side.

Serve topped with pesto and lemon wedges. Serves 4.

title: 245. GRILLED POTATOES IN A PACKAGE
info:
GRILLED POTATOES IN A PACKAGE

ingredients

2 potatoes per packages
sliced onions and peppers (any other veggies you prefer)
1 Tbsp. butter
salt and pepper to taste
sliced American or cheddar cheese

preparation

Tear off a piece of non-stick foil about 10-12 inches long. Peel and cut the potatoes, add the sliced onions and peppers, along with the tablespoon of butter and salt and pepper into the center of the foil. Fold the foil and close it tightly at the top and on the sides. Cook it on the grill on low for approximately 30 minutes. Once the potatoes are done, open the packet (be careful of the steam), put slices of the cheese on the potatoes and close the packet up so it can melt.

title: 46. FOIL WRAPPED VEGGIES ON GRILL
info:
FOIL WRAPPED VEGGIES ON GRILL

ingredients

3 medium zucchini, sliced
3 medium tomatoes, sliced
1 green pepper, sliced
1 envelope onion soup mix
1/4 c. margarine, softened
2 Tbsp. brown sugar
salt and pepper

preparation

Cut a large square of heavy-duty aluminum foil. Mix all ingredients and place on square. Fold up securely so no juices escape. Place on charcoal grill, turning once during cooking, 45 minutes to 1 hour. May also be placed in 350° oven. Serves 6.

title: 185. GRILLED GROUPER
info:
GRILLED GROUPER

ingredients

1 to 1 1/2 lb. grouper fillet with skin on
1/4 c. butter or margarine
1/4 c. lemon juice
1/8 tsp. garlic (more is optional)

preparation

Heat grill to medium. In a very small saucepan, melt butter. Add lemon juice and garlic. Place grouper, skin side down, on grill (do not turn). Baste with butter sauce approximately 3 times while grilling. Grilling time will be approximately 9 to 15 minutes, depending upon the thickness of the grouper.

title: 238. KEY WEST GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
KEY WEST GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

6 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
3 Tbsp. soy sauce
1 Tbsp. honey
1 Tbsp. olive or vegetable oil
1 tsp. lime juice
1 tsp. garlic powder

preparation

Place the chicken in a shallow dish; set aside. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients; mix well and pour over the chicken. Cover and marinate in refrigerator for 1 hour, turning occasionally.

Preheat grill. Cook the chicken over medium heat for about 10 minutes per side or until tender and no pink remains. Discard excess marinade.

title: 88. BASIC GRILLED SALMON STEAKS
info:
BASIC GRILLED SALMON STEAKS
(Easy; See Variations)

ingredients

6 (1 to 1 1/2-inch thick) salmon steaks with skin
2 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil, divided use
salt and pepper

preparation

If you are using charcoal, build a fire about 45 minutes before you plan to start cooking. If you're using a gas grill, turn it on about 10 minutes ahead of cooking.

Toss salmon steaks in half the olive oil. When the coals have completely ignited, spread them over a large enough area for the 6 steaks. Wait about 10 minutes so the coals end up coated with a fine layer of ash. Brush the grill with the remaining oil and set it about 6-inches from the coals. Give it about 5 minutes to heat up.

Season the salmon steaks with salt and pepper and place them on the grill. For 1-inch steaks, grill for 3 to 4 minutes on each side. If you're unsure whether the steaks are done, cut into one with a sharp paring knife. Serve immediately on hot plates. Makes 6 servings.

Salmon With Tomato Vinaigrette:

ingredients

3 Tbsp. red or white wine vinegar
1/4 tsp. salt
1/3 c. olive oil
1/8 tsp. freshly ground pepper
2 to 3 Tbsp. chopped fresh basil
1 Tbsp. minced shallots
2 Tbsp. capers
1 c. diced ripe tomato

preparation

Mix the vinegar with the salt. Whisk in the olive oil. Add the pepper, basil, shallots, capers and tomato. Spoon over freshly grilled, hot salmon steaks or fillets.

Herb-Crusted Salmon:

ingredients

3 Tbsp. each: finely chopped fresh parsley, cilantro and basil
1 1/2 tsp. chili powder
3/4 tsp. kosher salt
3/4 tsp. coarsely ground pepper
6 Tbsp. olive oil
1 1/2 tsp. soy sauce

preparation

Combine the parsley, cilantro and basil. Add the remaining ingredients. Mix thoroughly to make a paste. Substitute paste for seasonings in main recipe. Spread the paste evenly over the flesh of salmon steaks or fillets before grilling.

Mustard-Flavored Salmon: Mix 2 tablespoons each mustard and sugar and 2 teaspoons water to make a thick paste. Spread the paste over the flesh side of fillets or steaks.

title: 64. ZUCCHINI A LA GRILL
info:
ZUCCHINI A LA GRILL

ingredients

4 small zucchini (about 6 inches long)
1/4 c. olive oil
2 Tbsp. vinegar
1 Tbsp. fresh oregano or 1 tsp. dried oregano

preparation

Slice zucchini lengthwise into slices 1/4-inch thick. Mix remaining ingredients and brush on zucchini slices. Grill over hot coals until they begin to brown and soften. Serves 4 to 6.

title: 286. GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH
info:
GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH

ingredients

bread
American cheese slices
butter

preparation

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a frying pan. Make sandwiches, using 2 slices of bread and 1 piece of cheese for each. Place sandwich in pan and fry until lightly brown; turn over and brown on other side. Fry on medium heat.

title: 148. GRILLED LEG OF LAMB
info:
GRILLED LEG OF LAMB

ingredients

1 jar (8-oz) Dijon-style mustard
2 tsp. crushed rosemary
2 tsp. fresh ginger root, chopped
1 clove garlic, crushed
3 Tbsp. soy sauce
3 Tbsp. peanut oil
1 5 to 7 lb. leg of lamb, boned and flattened

preparation

In glass dish large enough to fit lamb, mix mustard, rosemary, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, and oil. Add lamb. Marinate overnight, turning after 1 hour. Remove lamb from marinade. Place on hot grill over gray coals. Cook 10 to 15 minutes on each side, depending on size of lamb. Part will be well-done, part medium-done, and part rare. This can also be broiled. Baste during cooking with marinade. Slice lamb on the diagonal. Serve with assorted vegetables, grilled alongside lamb. Serves 6 to 8.

title: 33. GRILLED HOT DOGS
info:
GRILLED HOT DOGS

ingredients

hot dogs
onion
sliced cheese
bacon

preparation

Slit hot dogs lengthwise. Fill with finely chopped onion. Cut cheese in 1/4-inch strips and place on top of onions. Wrap with a slice of bacon and pin with toothpick. Place on shallow pan and put under broiler or place on outside grill. Broil until bacon is crisp.

title: 78. GRILLED ITALIAN TOMATOES
info:
GRILLED ITALIAN TOMATOES

ingredients

3 large firm ripe tomatoes
2 Tbsp. commercial Italian dressing
1 1/2 tsp. basil
salt and pepper to taste
1/4 c. melted butter or margarine
1 c. breadcrumbs

preparation

Cut tomatoes in half crosswise and sprinkle each half with 1 teaspoon Italian dressing, 1/4 teaspoon basil, salt and pepper. Combine butter and breadcrumbs; spoon over tomato halves.

Place tomato halves on heavy-duty aluminum foil. Seal foil, leaving a small amount of space for steam to escape. Cook over hot coals for 10 minutes. Yields 6 servings.

title: 141. GRILLED HAM AND EGG SALAD SANDWICHES
info:
GRILLED HAM AND EGG SALAD SANDWICHES

ingredients

1 unsliced round loaf bread (8-inches)
2 Tbsp. horseradish
1/2 lb. thinly sliced cooked roast beef
2 Tbsp. prepared mustard
1/2 lb. thinly sliced cooked ham or turkey
4 slices Swiss cheese
2 Tbsp. mayonnaise
1 small tomato, thinly sliced
6 bacon strips, cooked
4 slices American cheese
1 small onion, thinly sliced
1/4 c. butter, melted
1 Tbsp. sesame seeds
1/2 tsp. onion salt

preparation

Slice bread horizontally into 5 equal layers. Spread bottom layer with horseradish; top with roast beef. Place next slice of bread over beef; spread with mustard on top with ham or turkey and Swiss cheese. Add next slice of bread and top with American cheese and onion. Cover with remaining bread. Combine butter, sesame seeds and onion salt. Brush over top and sides of loaf. Place on baking sheet; loosely tent with heavy duty aluminum foil. Bake at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through. Carefully slice into 8 wedges. Makes 8 servings.

title: 119. GRILLED CHICKEN WITH SWEET ONION RELISH
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN WITH SWEET ONION RELISH

Chicken:

ingredients

2 lb. skinless chicken pieces
1/2 c. orange juice
2 Tbsp. honey
1 Tbsp. Dijon mustard
1 Tbsp. grated gingerroot
2 tsp. reduced sodium soy sauce

preparation

Combine all ingredients in a large self closing bag, mixing well. Seal and marinate in refrigerator at least 2 hours, turning bag occasionally. Spray the grill with no stick spray before heating. Remove chicken from bag, reserving marinade. Place chicken on the rack over coals. Grill uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Brush frequently with reserved marinade while grilling. Serve with relish.

Relish:

ingredients

1 Tbsp. butter
1/2 c. chopped red onions
1/2 c. chopped green peppers
1/2 c. chopped tomatoes
3 Tbsp. all fruit orange spread
2 tbsp. chili sauce
1 Tbsp. cider vinegar
1/2 tsp. thyme (optional)

preparation

Melt butter in small saucepan. Add onions and peppers and cook until tender. About 4 minutes. Stir in rest of ingredients. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and set aside.

title: 18. BEST EVER GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
BEST EVER GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

1 large fryer, cut up
1 c. Italian salad dressing
1/2 c. lemon juice
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. garlic powder
1/2 tsp. onion powder
1/2 tsp. paprika
1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce

preparation

Place fryer into a bowl with a tight fitting lid. Combine all other ingredients and pour over chicken early in the day. Place in the refrigerator. Shake the bowl several times that day. Cook on an outdoor barbecue grill as you would any other chicken. Use the sauce to baste the chicken while cooking. The whole family should go for this one. Serves 4.

title: 221. ASIAN-STYLE GRILLED BEEF
info:
ASIAN-STYLE GRILLED BEEF

ingredients

2 Tbsp. soy sauce
1 Tbsp. sesame oil
1 Tbsp. brown sugar
1 lb. round steak, sliced into 1/4-inch strips
1 large carrot
6 green onions

preparation

Combine soy sauce, sesame oil and brown sugar in a medium baking dish; mix well. Add steak, stirring to coat. Preheat grill or broiler. Cut carrot and green onions into 1 1/2-inch slices. Remove steak from sauce. Reserve sauce. Thread carrot, green onions and steak onto 6 skewers. Brush kabobs with sauce. Grill or broil, turning once, until steak is browned, about 3 minutes on each side.

title: 84. EASY HERBED GRILLED SALMON
info:
EASY HERBED GRILLED SALMON

ingredients

1/2 lb. salmon filet
1 Tbsp. butter or margarine
1/2 lemon
2 Tbsp. white wine
1/2 tsp. salt (optional)
1/2 tsp. onion powder
1/2 tsp. garlic powder
1/2 tsp. lemon pepper
1 tsp. oregano
1/2 tsp. dill weed
1/2 tsp. parsley flakes
1/4 tsp. paprika

preparation

Preheat grill. Make a tray out of heavy-duty foil by folding a long piece in half and folding up all 4 sides with the dull side up. Spray the bottom of the foil tray with cooking spray. Place fish filet in the tray, skin side down. Smear a thin line of butter on filet. Squeeze lemon juice liberally over filet and then a splash of white wine. Sprinkle remaining seasonings lightly over filet and transfer the foil tray to the hot grill. Cover. Cook for 10 minutes per inch of thickness of filet. DO NOT overcook or it will be dry and unpalatable. Turning is not necessary. Salmon is done when it turns a light pink color throughout.

title: 70. GRILLED RED SNAPPER
info:
GRILLED RED SNAPPER

ingredients

8 portions of fish fillets
1/4 lb. butter
2 onions, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
juice from 2 limes or lemons
3 Tbsp. spicy mustard
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Melt butter in a saucepan. Add onions and sauté until clear. Add garlic, lemon/lime juice, mustard, salt and pepper.

Preparation time: 15 minutes. Cooking time: 10 to 15 minutes.

title: 59. GRILLED VEGGIES
info:
GRILLED VEGGIES

ingredients

2 medium zucchini
1/2 onion
1/2 lb. mushrooms
2 medium crookneck squash
3 tomatoes
4 Tbsp. margarine

preparation

Slice squash, onion and mushrooms. Chop tomatoes. Lay out on a large piece of heavy-duty foil. Cut butter in pieces and scatter over vegetables. Fold over foil and seal well. Cook on barbecue grill for 15 to 20 minutes, turning several times.

title: 22. Grilled Garlic Shrimp
info:
Grilled Garlic Shrimp

ingredients

2 lb. large unshelled shrimp, deveined
1/2 c. melted, unsalted butter
1/2 c. olive oil
1 Tbsp. minced shallots or green onions
3 large peeled cloves garlic
1 tsp. salt
1 1/2 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice
1/4 c. minced parsley
salt and freshly ground pepper
parsley sprigs (garnish)

preparation

Wash shrimp in cold water and dry well. Pour butter and olive oil into a 3-quart shallow bowl. Add shallots. Chop garlic with salt on a cutting board (this helps eliminate the strong garlic aftertaste). Add garlic and salt mixture to bowl. Roll shrimp in this mixture until well coated. Sprinkle with lemon juice and parsley. Marinate at least 30 minutes, turning shrimp several times.

Place shrimp on gas grill over medium flame and grill 5 to 7 minutes on each side, depending on size of shrimp. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve in individual dishes and spoon heated marinade over them. Garnish with parsley. Yield: 6 servings.

title: 186. GRILLED SALMON
info:
GRILLED SALMON

ingredients

1 to 1 1/2 lb. salmon fillets with skin on
1/4 c. butter or margarine
1/4 c. lemon juice
1/8 tsp. garlic (more is optional)

preparation

Heat grill to medium. In a very small saucepan, melt butter. Add lemon juice and garlic. Place salmon, skin side down, on grill (do not turn). Baste with butter sauce approximately 3 times while grilling. Grilling time will be approximately 9 to 15 minutes, depending on the thickness of the salmon.

title: 292. GRILLED CHICKEN PASTA SALAD
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN PASTA SALAD

ingredients

1 (17 oz.) pkg. multi-color spiral pasta
1 c. julienne carrots
1/2 c. red and green bell peppers, diced fine
1 c. raw broccoli florets
1 (8 oz.) bottle Paul Prudhomme's poultry seasoning
1 (8 oz.) bottle Ranch dressing
1 (8 oz.) bottle Italian dressing
Blue cheese crumbles (optional)
8 skinless, boneless chicken breasts

preparation

Cook pasta according to package. Rinse with cold water. Season chicken breasts, back and front, with poultry seasoning. Grill or saut. Let cool. Cut in strips and then dice. Add vegetables and chicken to pasta. Mix dressings together and then add to pasta until you reach desired taste and consistency.

Optional (Tastes Great): Sprinkle with Blue cheese crumbles. Garnish with slices of fresh fruit. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: 149. SEAFOOD ON THE GRILL
info:
SEAFOOD ON THE GRILL

ingredients

lemon
butter
salt
pepper
any type seafood
onions
bell peppers

preparation

When grilling seafood, season with lemon, butter, salt, pepper, onions and bell peppers. Wrap in foil and place on grill for approximately 20 minutes. Easy to cook. Tastes great!

title: 30. GRILLED FISH
info:
GRILLED FISH

ingredients

2 lb. fish
1/2 c. salad oil
1/3 c. freshly squeezed lemon juice
1/4 c. chopped onion
2 Tbsp. capers and juice (optional)
2 Tbsp. catsup
1 tsp. salt
2 Tbsp. sugar
2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
4 bay leaves, crushed
1/4 tsp. pepper
2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
paprika

preparation

Marinate fish for 30 minutes in mixed ingredients. Cook on grill about 8 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Baste fish while grilling and sprinkle with paprika. Baste shrimp or scallops only, don't marinate.

title: 228. DILLY GRILLED TURKEY
info:
DILLY GRILLED TURKEY

ingredients

1 bone-in Turkey Breast half (2-1/2 to 3 lb)
1 c. plain non-fat yogurt
1/4 c. lemon juice
3 tsp. vegetable oil

preparation

This recipe calls for half of a fresh or frozen turkey breast. If your market carries only whole turkey breast, ask the butcher to cut one in half for you.

title: 16. TURKEY ON THE GRILL
info:
TURKEY ON THE GRILL

ingredients

1 (12 to 14 lb.) turkey
1 stick butter
2 stalks celery
1 onion
salt and pepper
1 qt. water

preparation

You will also need heavy-duty aluminum foil (can use purchased foil pan).

Wash turkey thoroughly. Salt and pepper neck and body cavities and outside of turkey. Stuff cavities with celery and onions. Make an aluminum foil pan of 4 thicknesses of foil; pan should be about 2 inches deep. Place turkey in pan; place on gas grill which has been turned on "low." Pour one stick of melted butter over turkey and pour water in base of pan. Baste turkey at 30 minute intervals. Cook 4 1/2 to 5 hours with grill lid closed. Replace water as needed.

title: 49. POTATOES ON A GRILL
info:
POTATOES ON A GRILL

ingredients

potatoes (uncooked), sliced thin
green peppers, cut in pieces
1 large onion, chopped (or more if desired)
paprika, salt and pepper
butter

preparation

Mix together potatoes, green peppers and onion. Season with paprika, salt and pepper. Put mixture on heavy-duty foil and dab butter on top in several places. (Spraying the inside of foil with Pam helps a lot!) Wrap the potatoes in the foil real well and cook on grill, turning often, about 1/2 hour. Can be done in oven at about 400°.

title: 189. CRACKER BARREL GRILLED CHICKEN TENDERLOIN
info:
CRACKER BARREL GRILLED CHICKEN TENDERLOIN

ingredients

1 lb. chicken breast tenders
1/2 c. Italian dressing, drain and discard spices
1 tsp. fresh lime juice
1 1/2 tsp. honey

preparation

Mix dressing, lime juice and honey together. Pour over chicken tenders, making sure all tenders are covered. Marinate 1 hour. Braise tenders in a nonstick pan or grill to lightly golden in color, but not dry.

title: 43. GRILLED CARROTS
info:
GRILLED CARROTS

ingredients

6 medium carrots
1 Tbsp. dehydrated onion flakes
1/2 tsp. garlic salt
black pepper to taste
1/4 c. soy sauce
1/4 c. water
2 Tbsp. wine vinegar

preparation

Place carrots on a large double layer of aluminum foil; fold up sides to form a container. Sprinkle carrots with onion flakes, garlic salt and pepper. Combine all remaining ingredients in a small jar or measuring cup; pour over carrots. Wrap foil tightly around carrots to make a packet. Marinate 2 hours, turning occasionally. Remove carrots from foil; place on hinged grill or on a rack 4 inches from source of heat. Grill 45 minutes or until carrots are tender. Makes 6 servings.

title: 205. MARINADE FOR GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
MARINADE FOR GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

1/2 c. soy sauce
1/4 c. white wine or lemon juice
1/4 c. oil
1/4 c. chopped onion
1/4 tsp. fresh minced garlic

preparation

Mix all ingredients and pour over boneless chicken breasts. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, but preferably 2 hours. Grill on medium heat for about 4 minutes on each side or until done.

Note: I usually pound the breasts slightly to have a consistent thickness for even cooking.

title: 66. GRILLED FRENCH BREAD
info:
GRILLED FRENCH BREAD

ingredients

1 unsliced loaf French bread
1/2 c. soft butter
2 Tbsp. minced parsley
onions
1/2 tsp. garlic powder
1 tsp. celery salt

preparation

Mix butter, parsley, onions, garlic powder and celery salt. Cut bread into 1-inch slices, cutting to bottom crust but not through. Spread butter mixture on each slice. Wrap in heavy-duty aluminum foil. Heat over hot coals for about 20 minutes. Turn often during heating.

title: 258. "GRILLED MARINATED CHICKEN BREAST"
info:
"GRILLED MARINATED CHICKEN BREAST"

ingredients

1/2 c. soy sauce
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 Tbsp. brown sugar
1 Tbsp. olive oil
1 tsp. ginger
1/2 tsp. meat tenderizer
6 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, halved
bottle of Hellmann's honey mustard

preparation

Combine first 5 ingredients in Ziploc bag; shake to mix well. Add chicken. Seal and chill 1 hour, turning once. Remove chicken from marinade, discarding marinade.

Grill chicken covered with lid over medium-high heat (350° to 400°) for 5 to 8 minutes on each side or until done. Drizzle with honey mustard. Serve over bed of white rice with mango salsa.

"Mango Salsa":

ingredients

2 ripe mangoes, peeled and diced or 1 (26 oz.) jar refrigerated mango slices may be substituted
1 medium red bell pepper, diced
1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced
2 Tbsp. mint
1 small red onion, chopped
3 Tbsp. honey
1 Tbsp. fresh lime juice
1/4 tsp. ground red pepper
1/4 tsp. salt

preparation

Stir together all ingredients; cover and chill at least 2 1/2 hours.

title: 260. GRILLED TRI-TIP ROAST
info:
GRILLED TRI-TIP ROAST

ingredients

1/2 c. fresh lime juice
1/2 c. chopped fresh cilantro
1/2 c. olive oil
1/3 c. soy sauce
1/4 c. tequila
7 garlic cloves, finely chopped
2 tsp. grated lime peel
2 tsp. ground cumin
2 tsp. dried oregano
1 tsp. ground black pepper
2 (2 lb.) beef loin tri-tip roasts, trimmed

preparation

Whisk first 10 ingredients in medium bowl. Using small sharp knife, pierce meat all over. Place meat in large resealable plastic bag; add marinade. Seal bag. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight, turning plastic bag occasionally.

Prepare barbecue (medium-high). Remove meat from marinade. Discard marinade. Grill meat to desired doneness, about 10 minutes per side for medium-rare. Transfer to cutting board. Tent with foil; let stand 10 minutes. Cut diagonally across grain. Serve meat with Cherry Tomato Relish.

Cherry Tomato Relish:

ingredients

1/4 c. balsamic vinegar
4 tsp. chopped fresh oregano
3/4 c. olive oil
2/3 c. drained canned diced mild green chilies
4 green onions, finely chopped
4 c. halved cherry tomatoes

preparation

Whisk vinegar and oregano in medium bowl to blend. Gradually whisk in oil. Mix in green chilies and green onions. (Can be made 6 hours ahead. Cover; chill.) Add tomatoes; toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper.

title: 60. GRILLED SUMMER VEGETABLES
info:
GRILLED SUMMER VEGETABLES

ingredients

4 medium size new potatoes, cut in 1/4-inch slices
2 medium zucchini, cut into 1/4-inch pieces
1 medium yellow squash, cut into 1/4-inch slices
1 medium onion, thinly sliced
1 medium yellow pepper, seeded and cut into thin strips
1/2 tsp. dried whole basil or 2 tsp. chopped fresh basil
1/2 tsp. freshly ground pepper

preparation

Cook potatoes in boiling water to cover 5 minutes or just until tender; drain. Arrange equal amounts of potato, zucchini, squash, yellow peppers and onion on 4 squares of aluminum foil. Sprinkle with equal amounts of basil and pepper. Fold foil over vegetables, sealing securely. Grill over medium coals 15 minutes, turning once. Serves 4.

title: 184. STEAK HOUSE-STYLE GRILLED STEAK
info:
STEAK HOUSE-STYLE GRILLED STEAK

ingredients

2 tsp. garlic powder
2 tsp. onion powder
2 tsp. brown sugar
1 tsp. coarsely ground black pepper
4 beef tenderloin steaks
vegetable oil

preparation

Mix seasonings and brown sugar. Brush steaks with oil. Sprinkle seasoning mixture over both sides; press into steaks. Place steaks on medium-hot grill. Grill 6 to 8 minutes on each side or until cooked to desired doneness.

title: 42. MESQUITE GRILLED CAJUN TURKEY
info:
MESQUITE GRILLED CAJUN TURKEY

ingredients

3 lb. boneless breast of turkey, thawed
oil
1 Tbsp. onion flakes
1 Tbsp. garlic powder
1/2 tsp. thyme leaves
1/4 tsp. cayenne
1/4 tsp. anise seed
1/4 tsp. ground cloves
1/4 tsp. ground allspice
1 bay leaf, crushed

preparation

Prepare grill for indirect method. Brush turkey with oil. Combine remaining ingredients and sprinkle over turkey. Place turkey on grill. Cover grill and cook according to package directions. Wrap in foil and let stand 10 to 15 minutes. Remove netting from turkey and slice turkey.

title: 101. HONEY LIME GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
HONEY LIME GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

1/2 cup honey
1/3 cup soy sauce
1/4 cup line juice
4 boneless, skinless, chicken breast halves

preparation

In a resealable plastic bag, combine the honey, soy, and lime juice, mix well. Add chicken and turn to coat. Seal and refrigerate for 30 - 45 minutes. Drain and discard the marinade. Grill the chicken uncovered, over medium heat for 6 - 7 minutes on each side or until juices run clear.

title: 200. Grilled Pizza
info:
Grilled Pizza
(Yield: 4 Servings)

ingredients

1 package Fresh Pizza Dough
2 Tbsp. Olive Oil
2 cloves Garlic, minced
1/2 cup Freshly Grated Parmesan Cheese
1 1/2 cups Shredded Mozzarella Cheese

preparation

1. Lightly brush 10 x 15-inch cookie sheet with olive oil.

2. Roll out pizza dough to fit and press onto cookie sheet. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze 1 hour.

3. Heat grill on high.

4. Remove plastic wrap from top of frozen dough and lightly brush top of dough with olive oil.

5. Turn over dough onto hot grill. Cover grill and cook until bottom is lightly browned. Brush top with olive oil and turn over.

6. Sprinkle garlic, parmesan and mozzarella on top. Lower grill heat to low and cover grill. Cook until cheese is melted and underside is browned - about 5-8 minutes. Slide back onto cookie sheet and let stand 3 minutes.

7. Slice and enjoy!
