title: 171. GRILLED HERB CHICKEN SALAD
info:
GRILLED HERB CHICKEN SALAD

ingredients

4 (6 oz.) chicken breasts, skinned
vegetable spray
Italian seasoning
romaine lettuce head, washed and torn
1/2 c. black olive slivers
1/4 c. diced red onion
4 large Roma tomatoes, quartered
1 1/2 tsp. dijon mustard
1/3 c. white wine vinegar
1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/4 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
1 c. olive oil

preparation

Rinse and pat chicken breasts dry, cut the chicken into chunks. Spray a medium skillet with vegetable spray. Over medium-high heat, place chicken in skillet and sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Cook until chicken is no longer pink. In a large bowl, place romaine lettuce, olives and red onion. In a small bowl or pitcher, mix dijon mustard, white wine vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper and olive oil. Pour mixture over salad and toss well. Place tomato quarters around the inside edge of bowl. Serve immediately. Serves 4 as a meal or 6 as a side salad.

title: 19. CHARCOAL GRILLED FILLETS IN FOIL
info:
CHARCOAL GRILLED FILLETS IN FOIL

ingredients

2 lb. fresh fillets
2 green peppers, sliced
1 medium size onion, sliced
1/4 c. melted margarine or butter
2 Tbsp. lemon juice
1 tsp. paprika
dash of pepper

preparation

Cut fillets into serving-size portions. Cut 4 pieces of aluminum foil 12 x 12-inches each. Grease lightly. Place fish skin side down on foil. Top with green pepper and onion. Mix and pour sauce over fish. Bring foil up over fish and close all edges with tight double folds. Place package on grill about 5 inches from hot coals. Cook for 25 to 30 minutes or until fish flakes or turns shiny white. Serves 4.

title: 218. GRILLED PORTABELLA MELTS WITH BASIL AND TOMATO
info:
GRILLED PORTABELLA MELTS WITH BASIL AND TOMATO

ingredients

1/4 c. olive oil
2 Tbsp. balsamic vinegar
1/2 tsp. dried basil leaves, crushed
1/4 tsp. salt
1 (6 oz.) pkg. portabella mushroom caps
Italian bread, sliced 1-inch thick
Mozzarella cheese, sliced
tomato, sliced
chopped fresh basil leaves

preparation

In medium nonmetal bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. Add mushrooms; toss to coat well. Cover; marinate 1 to 2 hours, stirring occasionally.

Remove mushrooms from marinade; reserve marinade. Grill mushrooms 6 to 8 minutes or until crisp on the surface, turning often. Brush bread with remaining marinade; grill until lightly toasted.

To serve: Top each bread slice with a grilled mushroom, a slice of cheese and tomato; garnish with fresh basil. Serve immediately.

title: 270. GRILLED KODIAK SCALLOPS
info:
GRILLED KODIAK SCALLOPS

ingredients

1 lb. large Alaska scallops
4 Tbsp. butter
3 Tbsp. flour
1/4 c. dry white wine
3 c. heavy cream
1/2 c. sweet Gorgonzola
8 oz. fresh fettuccine
1/2 c. bergamot (bee balm) flowers

preparation

Heat grill or broiler. In heavy saucepan, melt butter and add flour. Cook for 5 minutes over low heat, stirring constantly. Do not allow to brown. Add wine and cream and bring to boil. Reduce heat and allow sauce to simmer 10 minutes or until it thickens slightly. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Remove from heat and strain. Keep warm. Bring large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta. Cook until pasta is done and drain. While pasta is cooking, grill scallops 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Toss pasta in some of the sauce and divide onto 4 heated plates. Arrange scallops over pasta and sprinkle pasta with bergamot flowers.

title: 216. GRILLED ROAST BEEF AND SWISS SANDWICHES
info:
GRILLED ROAST BEEF AND SWISS SANDWICHES

ingredients

rye or sourdough bread
roast beef, sliced thin from the deli (garlic roast beef is great)
Swiss cheese
mayonnaise
spicy mustard or horseradish

preparation

Mix equal parts mayonnaise with spicy mustard or horseradish. Spread this mixture on inside of bread. Add meat and cheese. Butter outside of bread and grill as you would a grilled cheese sandwich.

title: 72. BURRITO BURGERS ON THE GRILL
info:
BURRITO BURGERS ON THE GRILL

ingredients

1 c. refried beans
1/4 c. onion, chopped
1 1/2 lb. ground beef
8 flour tortillas
1 tomato, chopped
1 (4 oz.) can mild green chili peppers, drained, seeded and chopped
4 slices sharp American cheese
1 c. lettuce, chopped

preparation

Combine beans, 2 tablespoons of chili peppers, onion and 3/4 teaspoon salt. Add beef; mix well. Form into eight 5-inch patties. Cut cheese slices in half. Place 1/2 cheese slice on each beef patty. Fold to seal cheese inside. Grill over medium coals 5 to 6 minutes. Turn and grill 4 to 5 minutes more. Heat tortillas on grill. Serve burgers in hot tortillas. Add the lettuce, tomatoes and remaining chili peppers as desired.

title: 143. GRILLED VEGETABLE AND RAVIOLI SALAD
info:
GRILLED VEGETABLE AND RAVIOLI SALAD

ingredients

1 pkg (9 oz) Buitoni Light four cheese Ravioli, cook and drained
1 lb assorted grilled vegetables, such as onion, zucchini, peppers and eggplant
1 c lightly packed, torn assorted salad greens
1 (15 oz) container Buitoni Garden Vegetable Sauce
2 Tbsp olive oil
2 Tbsp red wine vinegar

preparation

Combine pasta, vegetables and salad greens in a medium bowl. Combine sauce, oil and vinegar in small bowl; mix will. Add sauce mixture to pasta mixture; toss well. Serve immediately.

title: 131. GRILLED BEEF STEAKS-BULGARIA
info:
GRILLED BEEF STEAKS-BULGARIA
(Govezhdy Purzholy Na Skara)

ingredients

2 pounds of beef steaks (4 big pieces)
2 sticks butter
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. black pepper

preparation

Grease both sides of steak with butter. Roast on grill for 5-6 minutes, or until browned. Lightly butter and salt both sides. Roast other side until brown. Place on dish and sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Serves 4-6.

title: 54. GRILLED EGGPLANT
info:
GRILLED EGGPLANT

ingredients

1/2 c. olive oil
1/4 c. red wine vinegar
1/2 lemon (for the juice)
2 cloves garlic, crushed
1 Tbsp. chopped rosemary leaves
1 Tbsp. chopped oregano leaves
1 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. ground pepper
2 small or 1 large eggplant, cut into 1-inch thick pieces

preparation

Combine all the ingredients for the marinade. Place in a flat-bottomed pan, such as a 9 x 13-inch cake pan. Place the eggplant slices in the pan. Allow the slices to soak on each side for at least 10 minutes per side. Grill over hot coals until soft. Occasionally drizzle with the marinade. When eggplant is very tender, serve immediately. Serves 4.

title: 220. GRILLING MARINADE
info:
GRILLING MARINADE

ingredients

1/2 c. soy sauce
1 1/2 Tbsp. brown sugar
1/3 c. pineapple juice
3/4 Tbsp. honey
1 Tbsp. salad oil
1 clove garlic, crushed
3 inches scallion stems, chopped coarsely
1/4 tsp. ground ginger

preparation

Combine ingredients in saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and let cool. Use to marinate chicken, beef or pork two to three hours before grilling or broiling. Makes 1 cup.

title: 31. HOT OFF THE GRILL HAM STEAKS
info:
HOT OFF THE GRILL HAM STEAKS

ingredients

ham steaks, cut about 1/2 inch thick
1 c. brown sugar
1/3 c. horseradish
1/4 c. lemon juice

preparation

Combine sugar, horseradish and lemon juice; boil for 2 to 3 minutes. Brush on ham steaks and grill. Watch carefully, they burn easily. Tasty!

title: 160. GRILLED ROSEMARY PORK ROAST
info:
GRILLED ROSEMARY PORK ROAST

ingredients

3 medium tart apples, peeled and chopped
1 c. unsweetened apple cider or juice
3 green onions, chopped
3 Tbsp. honey
1-2 Tbsp. minced fresh rosemary, or 1-2 tsp. dried and crushed
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 (3 lb.) boneless pork loin roast

preparation

In a saucepan combine the first six ingredients; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Cool slightly. Place pork roast in a large resealable plastic bag; add half the marinade. Cover and refrigerate overnight, turning occasionally. Transfer remaining marinade to a bowl; cover and refrigerate.

Drain and discard marinade that covered the roast. Grill roast, covered, over indirect medium-low heat for 1-1/2 to 2 hours or until a meat thermometer reads 160°, turning occasionally. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing. Heat reserved marinade; serve with roast. Serves 8.

title: 159. GRILLED CATFISH FILETS
info:
GRILLED CATFISH FILETS

ingredients

5-6 catfish filets
1 tbsp. butter per filet
Salt
Pepper
Paprika
Minced garlic
1 lemon

preparation

Melt butter in microwave. Place filet on single piece of aluminum foil seasoning with salt, pepper, paprika and garlic to taste. Thinly slice lemon and squeeze lemon juice over filet. Place lemon on filet and wrap each in foil, sealing tightly. Grill on high heat for 8-10 minutes or until filet turns white.

title: 67. GRILLED CORNBREAD
info:
GRILLED CORNBREAD

ingredients

1 Tbsp. butter
2 large eggs
2/3 c. milk
8 oz. can creamed corn
2 (12 oz.) pkg. corn muffin mix
1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
4 slices bacon, crisply cooked and crumbled

preparation

In an 8 or 9-inch foil pan, melt butter. Turn off heat; swirl butter to coat bottom and sides of pan. In large bowl beat eggs and milk to blend; stir in creamed corn. Add muffin mix and stir only until moistened. Turn into prepared pan. Sprinkle with cheese and bacon. Place pan on barbecue grill 6 inches above medium hot coals. Loosely cover top with foil. Cook about 30 minutes. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

title: 281. GRILLED CORN
info:
GRILLED CORN

ingredients

ears of corn, still in shucks

preparation

Buy ears of corn in shucks and soak in water. When water is absorbed into shucks, place on a hot grill. Grill about 20 minutes on low heat. The heat causes the water to steam inside shucks and cooks the corn. Serve with butter and salt.

title: 242. GRILLED CORN WITH GARLIC BUTTER
info:
GRILLED CORN WITH GARLIC BUTTER

ingredients

1/2 c. butter, softened
3 cloves garlic, minced
6 ears fresh corn, with husks

preparation

Stir together soft butter and minced garlic. Cover mixture and chill. Remove husks from corn, grill corn uncovered on a lightly greased grill rack over medium heat, about 10 minutes or until corn is tender. Turn several times as needed. Serve with garlic butter and salt while corn is still warm. 6 servings.

title: 52. GRILLED CINNAMON APPLES
info:
GRILLED CINNAMON APPLES

ingredients

apples
cinnamon candies
butter
raisins
cream (optional)

preparation

Place cored apple in center of 24-inch length of aluminum foil, folded in half. Fill hole with a tablespoon each of cinnamon candies and raisins. Dot with butter. Bring foil up loosely over apple and twist ends together to seal. Cook over glowing coals for 30 minutes, or until done. Serve with cream, if desired.

title: 140. OVEN GRILLED REUBENS
info:
OVEN GRILLED REUBENS

ingredients

2 cups refrigerated sauerkraut, rinsed & drained
3/4 tsp caraway seeds
3/4 cup fat free Thousand Island dressing
12 slices of rye bread, without seeds
6-1 oz slices reduced fat Swiss cheese
1 lb shaved corned beef

preparation

Heat oven to 350°. Mix together sauerkraut & caraway seeds. Spread dressing on one side of each slice of read. To 6 slices add corned beef. Top other 6 slices of bread (dressing side down). Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray & and arrange sandwiches on sheet. Coat a second baking sheet with spray and place coated side down on sandwiches and press lightly. Bake 15-20 minutes or until golden. Check after 10 minutes. Makes 6 sandwiches.

title: 161. GRILLED PORK TENDERLOIN
info:
GRILLED PORK TENDERLOIN

ingredients

1/2 c. peanut oil
1/3 c. soy sauce
1/4 c. red wine vinegar
3 Tbsp. lemon juice
2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1 clove garlic, crushed
1 Tbsp. chopped fresh parsley
1 Tbsp. dry mustard
1 1/2 tsp. pepper
2 (3/4 lb.) pork tenderloins

preparation

Combine first 9 ingredients. Place in heavy-duty zip top plastic bag or shallow container. Add tenderloins, turning to coat. Seal or cover and marinate in refrigerator at least 4 hours, turning occasionally. Remove tenderloins from marinade, discarding marinade. Grill tenderloins, uncovered, over medium coals (300° to 350°) for 16 minutes or until meat thermometer inserted in thickest part registers (160° for medium), 20 to 22 minutes for well-done (adjust thermometer), turning once. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes before slicing. Makes 6 servings.

Note: If you want to baste pork while grilling, reserve marinade and bring to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat and baste as desired.

Side Dishes: I serve this with red-skinned mashed potatoes, au gratin potatoes or rice.

title: 45. GRILLED CORN
info:
GRILLED CORN

ingredients

tender sweet corn
butter
salt and pepper

preparation

Strip husks down to the end of the cob, but do not tear off. Remove silk. If desired, soak in salted ice water to which 1/2 cup milk has been added for about 20 minutes; drain well. Brush with softened butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bring husks up around the corn. Wrap each ear securely in a double thickness of aluminum foil. Twist the ends well. Barbecue on briquets 10 minutes, turning once.

title: 90. GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

5 lb. chicken
1 c. water
5 cloves chopped garlic
1 medium finely chopped onion
1 Tbsp. sweet basil
1 tsp. oregano
1/2 tsp. dill weed
1/2 bottle Zesty Italian dressing

preparation

Marinate. Place on grill or bake.

title: 269. Grilled Shrimp
info:
Grilled Shrimp

ingredients

1 lb. Shrimp, peeled & de-veined
3/4 c. olive oil
1 1/2 t. dried basil
1/2 t. dried basil
1/2 t. crushed red pepper
3 garlic cloves, crushed

preparation

Combine above ingredients and marinate for 3 to 4 hours. Grill for approximately 5 - 7 minutes, turning halfway through cooking time. Serve with "Stone Country Honey cup Mustard" cut with a small amount of white wine for dipping.

title: 127. GRILLED CHICKEN FAJITAS
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN FAJITAS

ingredients

3 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
1 clove garlic, halved
1 medium green or red pepper, quartered
1/2 red onion, sliced 1/4-inch thick
1 1/2 c. Velveeta cheese
6 flour tortillas (6-inch), warmed
Taco Bell thick 'n chunky salsa

preparation

Rub both sides of chicken with garlic. Place chicken, green pepper and onion slices on greased grill over medium hot coals. Grill 20 minutes or until cooked through, turning occasionally. Cut chicken and green pepper into thin strips. Spoon chicken mixture and 1/4 cup Velveeta in center of each tortilla. Fold. Serve with salsa. Makes 6 servings.

title: 28. GRILLED CHUCK ROAST
info:
GRILLED CHUCK ROAST

ingredients

1 (4 lb.) chuck roast, 2 inches thick
unseasoned meat tenderizer
2 medium onions, sliced
1 tsp. grated lemon peel
2/3 c. fresh lemon juice
3 Tbsp. sugar
3/4 tsp. oregano
1/8 tsp. pepper
3 Tbsp. soy sauce

preparation

Sprinkle meat with tenderizer, piercing with a fork. Layer 1/2 of onions in large shallow glass dish; place meat over onions and top with remaining onions. Combine remaining ingredients; pour over meat and onions. Cover and refrigerate overnight or for 5 to 6 hours, turning several times. Remove meat and place on grill. Grill to desired doneness while simmering onions in marinade until tender. Carve across grain of meat into thin slices; serve with onions. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: 126. GRILLED QUESADILLA
info:
GRILLED QUESADILLA

ingredients

12 Rhodes Texas rolls, thawed and risen
3 c. grated Cheddar cheese
salsa (if desired)
chicken pieces (may add)

preparation

Flatten each roll into 8-inch circle on outdoor grill or on the stove top using a grilling pan. Grill one circle about 1 minute on each side. Grill another circle on one side. Turn over and top with 1/2 cup cheese. Put already grilled circle on top and allow bottom circle to grill. Repeat with each set of rolls. Serve warm with salsa, if desired. Makes 6 Quesadillas.

title: 98. TANGY GRILLED BEEF
info:
TANGY GRILLED BEEF

ingredients

1 can tomato soup
2 Tbsp. packed brown sugar
2 Tbsp. lemon juice
2 Tbsp. vegetable oil
1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1 tsp. garlic powder
1/4 tsp. dried thyme leaves, crushed
1 1/2 lb. boneless beef sirloin steak, 3/4 inch thick

preparation

Mix soup, sugar, lemon juice, oil, Worcestershire, garlic powder & thyme. Place steak on lightly oiled grill rack over medium- hot coals. Grill uncovered to desired doneness (allow 15 minutes for medium), turning once & brushing often with soup mixture. Heat remaining soup mixture to a boil & serve with steak.

title: 182. GRILLED GARLICKY CHICKEN BREASTS
info:
GRILLED GARLICKY CHICKEN BREASTS

ingredients

1 envelope Good Seasons roasted garlic salad dressing mix
1/2 c. grated Parmesan cheese
6 boneless skinless chicken breast halves

preparation

Mix salad dressing mix and cheese. Moisten chicken in water; dip in dressing mixture. Grill over medium-hot coals 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through.

title: 108. PIZZA GRILLED CHEESE
info:
PIZZA GRILLED CHEESE

ingredients

1 Tbsp. butter, softened
2 slices bread
1 slice cheese
2 Tbsp. pizza sauce
6 slices pepperoni (optional)

preparation

Butter one side of each slice of bread. Place one slice in a skillet, butter side down. Top with cheese, pepperoni, sauce and second slice of bread, butter side up. Cook over medium heat until golden brown, turning once.

title: 96. FIESTA GRILLED AVOCADOS
info:
FIESTA GRILLED AVOCADOS

ingredients

1 pkg. Fresher Lasting Jumbo Avocado Halves
2 Tbsp. olive oil
1 tsp. fajita seasoning
2 Seasoned Cilantro Lime Chicken Breasts
1 pkg. Fresher Lasting Roasted Salsa
1 c. shredded jalapeno jack or cheddar cheese

preparation

Place olive oil in a small bowl. Dip Avocado halves in olive oil. Sprinkle avocados with fajita seasoning and place on a sheet pan. Heat coals or grill to medium heat, 375 degrees. Brush hot grill with olive oil to prevent sticking. Grill chicken breasts according to package directions and thin slice. Grill avocados on cut side for 5 minutes. Turn avocados over and grill for 3 minutes. Place grilled avocados on a small foil lined baking pan and top with sliced chicken, salsa and shredded cheese. Place pan on grill and loosely cover with foil. Heat avocados for 3 more minutes until cheese melts. Serve warm.

title: 181. GRILLED TOP LOIN STEAKS
info:
GRILLED TOP LOIN STEAKS

ingredients

beef top loin, cut 1 to 1 1/2-inches
salt and pepper
Vegetable Packets

preparation

Place steaks on grill over ash-covered coals so they are 2 to 3-inches from coals. Broil at medium temperature. When first sides are browned, turn and season with salt and pepper and finish cooking on second side. Steaks 1-inch thick require about 12 to 15 minutes for rare, 18 to 20 minutes for medium. Steaks cut 1 1/2-inches thick require 22 to 25 minutes for medium. Serve Vegetable Packets with steaks.

Vegetable Packets:

ingredients

2 medium tomatoes, sliced 1/4-inch thick
2 medium onions, sliced thin
2 medium green peppers, cut into rings
12 mushrooms, halved
salt and pepper

preparation

Alternately place slices of tomato, onion and green pepper in 4 overlapping pieces of foil each 9 x 12. Top each with mushrooms; season with salt and pepper and 1 teaspoon butter. Close foil packs with double fold. Turn up ends and fold to close securely. Place on grill and cook at medium temperature for 10 to 15 minutes or until vegetables are done. Makes 4 to 5 servings.

title: 21. CHARCOAL GRILLED WHITE FISH
info:
CHARCOAL GRILLED WHITE FISH

ingredients

2 1/2 or 3 lb. white fish (trout, snapper or mackerel may be used)
1/4 c. olive oil
1/2 c. fresh lemon juice
3/4 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. pepper
1 Tbsp. oregano
1/2 tsp. Accent

preparation

Make 4 or 5 shallow slits on each side of fish. Brush fish generously with a mixture of oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper, oregano and Accent. Cook over coals until golden brown, brushing with mixture. Turn fish gently to cook both sides. When fish is done, put on serving platter and pour remaining mixture over fish. Serves 3 to 4.

title: 201. Grilled Chicken and Pasta
info:
Grilled Chicken and Pasta
(Yield: 4-6 Servings)

ingredients

12 oz. Hopkins Inn House Salad Dressing
1 pkg. 3 Chicken Breasts, skinless and boneless
2 oz. Pine Nuts
1 (16 oz.) box Egg and Spinach Fettuccine
2 cups String Beans or Asparagus
2 Tbsp. Olive Oil

preparation

1. Marinate chicken breasts in 3 oz. salad dressing for at least 2 hours.

2. Grill or bake chicken until done.

3. Cut chicken into mouth-sized pieces.

4. In frying pan, heat olive oil and brown pine nuts. Set aside

5. Cook fettuccine.

6. Steam string beans.

7. In glass bowl, microwave remainder of Hopkins Inn dressing until hot.

8. In a large pasta bowl, toss pasta, pine nuts, chicken, string beans and dressing.

Note: Can be served hot or cold.

title: 284. MESQUITE GRILLED VEGETABLE PLATTER
info:
MESQUITE GRILLED VEGETABLE PLATTER

ingredients

3 medium zucchini, sliced 1/2 inch thick
1 lb. Asparagus, cut into pieces
3 red bell peppers, seeded and sliced
1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and sliced
1 lb. Mushrooms, cleaned
3 Tbsp. Mrs. Dash Mesquite Grilled Blend
1/2 Cup Vegetable oil

preparation

Combine oil and Mrs. Dash Mesquite Grilling Blend in a large mixing bowl. Add vegetables and toss. Preheat barbecue grill to medium heat. Place vegetables in a grill basket on barbecue grill (or hot skillet). Cook vegetables, turning 2-3 times until vegetables are tender and cooked through, about 15 minutes. Remove and place on a large platter, serve.

Serves 12.

title: 289. GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICHES
info:
GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICHES

ingredients

Butter or Margarine
2 slices of white bread
1 slice American cheese

preparation

Butter 1 side of each slice of bread, on the unbuttered side, place a slice of cheese, placing the other slice of bread on top of cheese, buttered side up. In a medium low skillet, cook each side of the sandwich about 2 minutes, turning until lightly browned and cheese is melted in center. You can add a slice of ham before cooking to make a grilled ham and cheese sandwich.

title: 253. HONEY-LIME GRILLED CHICKEN
info:
HONEY-LIME GRILLED CHICKEN

ingredients

1/2 c. honey
1/3 c. soy sauce
1/4 c. lime juice
4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves

preparation

In a resealable plastic bag or shallow glass container, combine honey, soy sauce and lime juice. Mix well.

Add chicken and turn to coat. Seal and marinate 30 to 45 minutes. Drain and discard marinade. Grill chicken uncovered for 6 to 7 minutes on each side or until juices run clear. Makes 4 servings.

title: 145. GRILLED TURKEY TENDERLOIN
info:
GRILLED TURKEY TENDERLOIN

ingredients

1/4 c. low sodium soy sauce
1/4 c. sherry wine or apple juice
1/8 tsp. black pepper
2 Tbsp. crushed onion
1 lb. uncooked turkey tenderloin (3/4 to 1-inch thick)
1/4 c. peanut oil
2 Tbsp. lemon juice
1/8 tsp. garlic salt
1/4 tsp. ground ginger

preparation

In a shallow pan, blend all marinade ingredients together. Add turkey, turning to coat both sides. Cover; marinate in refrigerator several hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Grill the tenderloins over hot coals, 8 to 10 minutes per side, depending on the thickness. Tenderloins are done when there is no pink in the center; do not overcook. Serve in 1/4-inch thick slices in toasted buns. Yields 4 servings.

title: 237. GRILLED CHICKEN PASTA
info:
GRILLED CHICKEN PASTA

ingredients

Tyson grilled chicken strips (precooked frozen)
pasta (your favorite kind; rotini, elbow, etc.)
Zesty Italian dressing (fat-free)
California style vegetables (frozen; broccoli, carrots and cauliflower)
Nature's Seasons

preparation

Thaw out desired amount of chicken and cut into bite size pieces. Cook desired amount of pasta according to directions; rinse. Thaw vegetables; set aside. Mix chicken, pasta and vegetables; stir in Italian dressing, enough to coat. Sprinkle Nature's Seasons and toss. Enjoy warm or cold.

title: 128. BOURBON GRILLED SALMON
info:
BOURBON GRILLED SALMON

ingredients

8 fresh (6 oz.) salmon filets (about 1-inch thick)
1 c. lite soy sauce (reduced sodium)
1/2 c. water
1/2 c. bourbon whiskey
1 1/2 c. light brown sugar
1/2 tsp. powdered ginger
1 tsp. garlic powder
1/2 tsp. cayenne pepper
4 Tbsp. salted butter

preparation

Rinse the salmon filets and place them on a covered, paper towel-lined plate in the refrigerator. Prepare the marinade by placing all the ingredients, except the butter and half of the brown sugar, in the blender of food processor and mix well. Reserve 1/2 cup of the marinade and set aside. Lay the salmon out in a nonmetallic casserole dish and pour the marinade evenly over all the filets. Cover and place in the refrigerator for a minimum of 4 hours (overnight is fine). Combine the butter and the remaining marinade in a small saucepan; warm over medium heat. When the butter has melted, whisk in the brown sugar, stirring vigorously for 3 minutes to complete the glaze and reserve. Grill the fish over medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes per side. Baste liberally with the glaze just before serving. This dish holds well in a warm oven.

title: 61. GRILLED TOMATO HALVES
info:
GRILLED TOMATO HALVES

ingredients

4 large firm tomatoes
1/4 c. butter or margarine, melted
1/4 c. dry bread crumbs
1/4 c. wheat germ
1/4 c. Parmesan cheese
1/2 tsp. marjoram
1/4 tsp. seasoned salt
1/8 tsp. coarsely ground pepper

preparation

Cut tomatoes in half and place in shallow pan, cut side up. Combine remaining ingredients well and spread on tomatoes. Bake in a 450° oven 8 to 10 minutes or until tops are lightly browned.

GREAT GRILLED BURGERS

ingredients

2 lb ground chuck
2 tbsp hidden valley ranch dry mix
2 tsp worcestershire sauce
1/4 tsp garlic salt
dash of pepper
velveeta

preparation

Mix together and form patties. Can be grilled or fried. I use a George Foreman grill. Brown patties and remove. Add thinly sliced velveeta to hot patties. Garnish as desired.
